178176.name: High and Dry
178176.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this introductory adventure for Bethorm: the Plane of Tekumel RPG, the heroes journey to the small town of Mishábar, east of Katalál near an ancient ruined stone castle, where a recent series of disappearances have brought the local clan’s farming business to a halt. Who – or what – has taken three of the clan’s women? The players must identify the cause, and find a solution so that the grain may flow again.

Suitable for 4 to 6 beginning player characters. Includes 9 illustrations and 3 color maps!

178177.description:
Join adventurers in the year 1010 after the fall of Bosparan. The Kingdom of Raul fears for the fate and safety of Emperor Hal, who has disappeared without a trace on a hunting trip in the Bornland. While the heir apparent, Brin of Gareth, searches for his father, discord is sown in the capital city by the influential noble Answin in a bid for the throne. The orcs in the Middle Kingdom plot to make haste and take advantage of this prime opportunity! Thousands pour forth, warlike in their midnight furs, from Orkland and scour the country with fire and death. Desperately, Prince Brin gathers his remaining followers to face the hordes of the Aikar Brazoragh, the chief chosen by the Ork gods, on the battlefield. While the third Orc invasion rages in Aventuria, the cards to power and prestige will be reshuffled in the glamorous Gareth capital city. Here the adventure begins!

In Orkensturm, the players take on the roles of those who have stayed behind in the Imperial City of Gareth. Will you choose to support Emperor Answin, the Usurper or the Rightful Heir to the throne, Brin of Gareth? Will Prince Brin succeed in routing the orcs and return home victorious from the battlefield? Or will he perish in battle, Answin remaining the only hope of the Middle Kingdom as a strong ruler? Which of them triumphs is uncertain, because the orc invasion has many possible outcomes. The players can exert their influence to support one of the factions — with direct effects on the end of the story.

Orkensturm is a board game for 3-8 players, age 14 and above, with more than 200 cards, eight different colored tiles sets and a large game board with illustrations from the World of the Black Eye by artist Nadine Schäkel.
178177.name: Orkensturm

178178.name: Betrayal at Lucir (Swords & Wizardry)
rpgseries: Sundered Chronicles: The Redemption of Aranure
178178.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the kingdom of Aranure fell long ago, the fey of the Luciran Woods were a key piece of the demon lord Malak’ s forces. Many of the fey in the woods succumbed to the influence of the demon lord and rallied behind his banner.

After the war was over, people returned to the town of Lucir, where they lived in peace for many years. The fey have become restless once again and tragedy has struck at the local Church of Aelastrea!

In this module, you’ll find:

The town of Lucir and the surrounding Luciran Woods, a detailed town and explorable area with room to grow.
Two events designed to take a moderate length game session each to complete, and written to be modular so they can be played with this adventure or dropped into your own.
Three brand new monsters.
Details on the religion of Aelastrea, Lady of Forests.

178179.name: Modern Ruins 5
178179.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 30 inch Battlemap of a Modern Ruin, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“It’s time for these prehistoric monsters to remember why they are supposed to be extinct!”—Mammoth Primordiod Commander

Modern Ruins 5 is a single exterior map of a sundered highway surrounded by six shattered and ivy covered skyscrapers.

Modern Ruins 5 is intended for use in modern, post-apocalyptic settings. It may also be of use in near or far-future science fiction as ruins of Earth or another planet’s civilization.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Humanity’s Last Gambit: The apocalypse was long thought to be of man’s decision when it would occur through nuclear fire, but it was nature that caused it. The earth’s tectonic plates ground together and produced some of the highest magnitude earthquakes on the Richter scale. Volcanoes all over the world erupted, even some long thought dormant. From the cracks in the earth and the lava emerged nature’s vengeance. Reptilian monsters that had slumbered since the Late Cretaceous period awoke ravenous. They assaulted the coastal cities and consumed the survivors of the initial natural disaster. After eating their fill, they hibernated for a time. Humanity dubbed them Hibersaurs, massive dinosaurs that slept within the earth until it was a hot enough to return.

The humans evacuated the coasts and went inland to try and create something that could save the human race from these massive monsters. They scrapped their tanks and other engines of war to create massive Primordiods of steel to match the monster’s scales, hydraulics to match their sinews, and a coolant system to withstand the heat generated by the fire Hibersaurs They made these Primordiods in the images of primal mammals, great apes, sabretooth tigers, mammoths, and other symbols of the strength of mammals.

When the Hibersaurs returned, the humans sent their Hibersaurs to meet them in the coastal cities to defend the heartland of what remains of humanity. Will the Primordiods defeat the Hibersaurs or will humanity be completely consumed by the massive appetites of the Hibersaurs?

178180.name: Maidenhill and Her Many Secrets
rpgissuearticle: Campaign Kits: Maidenhill and Her Many Secrets
rpgseries: Campaign Kits: Fantasy Adventure Plot Points
178180.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this book you will find a series of one-page adventures all based around the forestry and logging mecca of Maidenhill. These are short, encounter-based adventures, some of which relate to each other, but not all. Everything is playable as a stand-alone scenario. All of the adventures in this book are designed for a party of 4 players.

Campaign Kits: Fantasy Adventure Plot Points is a product line that provides short adventure plots to help aid in filling your campaigns downtime. Each Plot Point provides enough details for you to quickly drop them in your game and are perfect for creating a series of exciting side stories.

178181.name: Furball Rampage
178181.description:
It is the year 2062. The NSP received a cordial invitation to join visiting extra terrestrial dignitaries for a cup of intergalactic java. The purpose was to embark upon a unique journey of friendship and shared knowledge. But as with all things sinister, it was simply too good to be true. The aliens, who called themselves Repondors, imprisoned a handful of animals on the mothership. After years of experimentation the animals escaped with one thing on their minds: escape and return to earth.

This game is simple, quick and full of fun strategy.

178182.name: Life Is Strange: Episode 3 – Chaos Theory
178182.description:
User Summary

In the third episode of Life Is Strange, Chloe and Max continue to investigate what happened to Rachel and Kate. Who or what connects Rachel and Kate? And what are the consequences of Max's power?

178183.name: Colonial Civil War
178183.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your WarStar has been sent to invite the Colonial Planet of Corenth to the Quortium. They have diplomatically declined. You and your crew must see them safely home, but a hidden threat has stowed upon the WarStar "Unicorn". And it will threaten the peace and safety of everyone on board, and the planet too.

So slap on your helmet, radio HQ, hit "Turbo", and blast off for a couple hours of adventure!

178184.name: Stun Damage, New Weapons, and New Defenses
178184.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Sometimes you don’t want to kill your enemy. Sometimes you just need him to stop attacking you and just go to sleep so you can steal his stuff and leave him naked in the star port’s restroom."

Yes, that's derived from an actual game play quote which sparked the idea for this supplement.

This White Star micro-supplement is designed to provide Referees and players a new type of mechanic that allows non-lethal options. It includes several pieces of new gear which make use of those mechanics. And why not – I threw in some illustrations too.

178186.name: Sengoku Basara 4
178186.description:
Sengoku Basara 4 is a single player Hack and Slash game. At a glance, the game plays similarly to a Dynasty Warriors game or other Warrior Style games. Players choose characters from a diverse roster to face out against entire battlefields of enemies by themselves. The gameplay is accessible enough so that any player can jump in to the action, but rewards players for mixing up their combos by offering them more gold or power. This installment introduces new mechanics to the series while retaining older mechanics from previous games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sengoku Basara 4", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

178187.name: Shenmue Online
178187.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Shenmue Online was an MMORPG where players participate in scenarios from Shenmue II, joining one of three clans, led by Shen Hua, Xiu Ying, and Wu Ying Ren, all significant characters from the story.

Since 2006, news about Shenmue Online has slowly declined and reports of its cancellation have appeared on Destructoid and Wired News. Sega have yet to publicly confirm or deny the reports.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shenmue Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

178188.name: STRAFE
videogamehonor: 2016 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Single player) Nominee
178188.description:
User Summary

A 90's style game where the levels change and you must kill enemies.

178189.description:
After the defeat at Stalingrad and destruction of the 6th Army, the Wehrmacht has regained strength and it is ready to inflict the Soviets a Tactical defeat around Kursk, where huge Soviet forces are massing in preparation of the summer offensive.
In the first days of July, thousands of tanks will fight the greatest tank battle in history.

KURSK 1943 is a new concept game covering greatest tank battle in history fought in Russia in July 1943.

Developed on wooden blocks, over a colorful 86x64 cm mapboard, 400g thick.
The over 200 wooden/plastic components have been created by the best Italian artisinal industry and painted "A buratto", a technique usually adopted for painting car parts and accessories.

Historical Background
In July 1943, the Germans tried the last gambit in the East before the initiative switched (and remained) to the Soviets.
The Heer planned an offensive around the Kursk salient with the aim to annihilate the huge concentration of Soviet forces massing in the area. The outcome was the largest tank battle in history with tousands of tanks involved in close combat fights for days.

KURSK 1943 is a game for two players, one controls the Germans and the other one controls the Soviets.
Although based on history, players in command of the two sides can modify the evolution of the battle and of the history in the Eastern Front.

Rules Introduction
The rules are easy - 6 pages - players can start playing the game without too many rules to remember and the game is 5 turn long (90-120 minutes)
Then the 10 Optional Rules provide more specific and detailed rules for an enhanced realism, such as special Tank abilities (Blitz, Tiger Battallion, Charge), Soviet Minefields and Maskirovka, Retreat, Combined Attack, Morale...

Scale
A cm is approximately 7 km.
A turn is 5 'days' long.
A full strength counter represents a Leader or a Division (a Corps for the Soviets).

Fog of War
The game must be played with the Fog of War on (wooden blocks are placed on the map in such a way the opponent player can not see them).

Language: English, German, French, Spanish and Italian
Genre: Tactic
Turns: Turn-Based
Complexity: Entry Level to Basic, depending on which rules are used
Period: WW2
178189.name: KURSK 1943

178192.name: Random Urban Encounters
178192.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of boring treks around town and characters going shopping without any real interaction?

Isn't it time you spiced things up a little?

A collection of over 100 Random Encounters awaits within.

Designed for low- to mid-level characters, and including rules for the world's greatest roleplaying game.

This supplement also includes a few additional tables, such as a Weather Generator, a Tavern Name Generator, and random NPC Personality Traits. New street chase rules are also included, to give characters an exciting chase scene through city streets.

Additionally the Daytime and Night Encounter tables are included as a separate file with Printer Friendly settings!

178193.name: Daemonolatreia
178193.description:
From Publisher web:
Daemonolatreia is the expected continuation of Ars Malefica for Aquelarre, the acclaimed game of medieval demonic role.

De la web del editor:
Daemonolatreia es la esperada continuación de Ars Malefica para Aquelarre, el aclamado juego de rol demoníaco medieval.

178194.name: Bloody Basic: Classic Edition
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
178194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloody Basic takes the advanced Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing rules and boils them down to the essentials to make gaming easy, fast and fun.

The Classic Edition rules include rules for the classic races, classes, spells and monsters of fantasy role playing, including elves, dwarves, halflings, fighters, magic-users, clerics and thieves.

178195.name: Bloody Basic: Contemporary  Edition
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
178195.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloody Basic takes the advanced Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing rules and boils them down to the essentials to make gaming easy, fast and fun.

The Contemporary Edition rules include rules for the contemporary races, classes, spells and monsters of fantasy role playing, including automatons, drakkens, gnomes, fighters, sorcerers, clerics and thieves.

178196.name: Bloody Basic: Mother Goose   Edition
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
178196.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloody Basic takes the advanced Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing rules and boils them down to the essentials to make gaming easy, fast and fun.

The Mother Goose Edition rules include rules for the races, classes, spells and monsters of fairy tales, including little pigs, sprites, knaves, charming princes, woodsmen, and maidens.

178197.name: NOD (Issue 24 - Dec 2014)
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
178197.description:
From publisher blurb:

2014 comes to a close with the 24th issue of NOD! In this issue, we continue the Ende hex crawl started in NOD 23, detail some Indian divinities, get into some court intrigue, make monsters with a dictionary, explore the ancient Red Sea as a campaign setting, tangle with space genies, and meet some 1920's superheroes called the Roustabouts.

178198.name: NOD (Issue 25 - Apr 2015)
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
178198.description:
From publisher blurb:

First issue of 2015! In this issue, the Klarkash Mountains hex crawl through weird, goblin-infested mountains. Also - The Thirty Years War Camapaign, the Landsknecht class, a Pen & Paper Football Game (American Football), random tables for making weird ecologies and a couple magic items.

178199.name: Elenthar's Tower
178199.description:
From publisher blurb:

The great mage and mystic experimenter Elenthar has vanished, his tower in the city gone silent and locked tight. What has happened? His home stands still save for mysterious moaning sounds at night. What strange wonders may be found in the archmage’s home? Do you dare explore -- or even more daring -- loot this manor?

A complete Fantasy Hero adventure for 4-6 characters of no more than 750 total points, combined.

178200.name: The Lost Castle
178200.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lurking in the wilderness is an old dilapidated castle and the ruins of the nearby village. It has been taken over by the creatures of the wilds, but what lies inside these crumbling walls, and why are they being rebuilt? What lurks beneath the Lost Castle? And why was it abandoned so long ago?

The Lost Castle is a complete Fantasy Hero adventure with maps, locations, treasures, and all the information you need to run your game!

178201.name: Races of the Lost Spheres: Bloodborn
178201.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout the worlds of the Lost Spheres and beyond stand the slumbering Bloodwells awaiting to awaken with the power to create life with but a few drops of the blood of Man. Those Who Came Before left their knowledge to join in the wells and give rise to a race both more and less than human:

The Bloodborn!

Inside this book you will find a new race for your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game campaigns. Supporting a broad range of the newest content from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Class Guide and Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Unchained, the Bloodborn present a robust suite of racial options.

Included are:

The Sourcerune mechanic system providing new ways to explore old classes and support multiclass characters from both the core and Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Unchained systems.
Over two dozen feats supporting the racial mechanics and interacting with Rogue Genius Games’ Genius Guide to Runic Might I and II!
New Psionic powers and character options (including Sourcerunes) supporting the Ultimate Psionics system from Dreamscarred Press.
New spells to to alter the way your character’s runic powers work.
New prestige classes to support the rune mechanics, the Bloodrune Adept - a master of summoning up the hidden skills of blood and ancient knowledge from past lives, and the Zenith Caster - a tidal mystic able to reconcile magical and supernatural powers from two sources and synthesize them into a singular force.




And much more!

178202.name: Luther Arkwright: Roleplaying Across the Parallels
178202.description:
Publisher blurb:

Not one Earth, but an infinity of them, existing in parallel continua, their own paths, own histories, own futures, own mistakes. Most are unaware of the existence of a multiverse; but some parallels know that Earth is not alone, but mirrored.

ZeroZero knows. It watches the parallels, ensures their stability. ZeroZero knows that instability spreads like a disease, infecting each parallel until a critical mass is reached and cataclysm is guaranteed.

The Disruptors know. And they are intent on subverting the multiverse for their own ends, to destabilise countries, instigate wars, bring about destruction.

The Valhalla Project was established to stop the Disruptors; to uncover their plans, identify their agents, and eliminate them. Their best agent is Luther Arkwright, unique in the multiverse, a powerful psychic, but himself unstable. Arkwright does not work alone: there are others.

You.

Based on Bryan Talbot’s acclaimed graphic novels, Luther Arkwright: Roleplaying Across the Parallels is a RuneQuest supplement introducing the Arkwright multiverse and all the rules needed for adventuring in countless parallel dimensions. This book contains game rules for contemporary character creation, psionics, technology, firearms, vehicles and more!

Note: this is a supplement for RuneQuest and requires either the RuneQuest 6 rules or RuneQuest Essentials for full play.

178203.name: Its Tremulous Lair Bears Beings Betwixt
178203.description:
From publisher blurb:

A glistening tunnel network. Its glutinous walls and troves of spoil line a fecund darkness in which delvers are made anew.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted tunnel network as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including mouths, occupants, transformed matter, gelyp grafts and development.

The scrabblers could be detailed with items from Character: Odds & Ends Found on the Olde Worlde Adventurer, while the tunnel network could be simplified or extended using one or more of the maps in the Location, Landscape & World bundle, most obviously The Vermian Maze.

178204.name: Delwǝrʼs Dɑɪdʒest: Of Mycorrhizae, Addled Mere & Deigma
178204.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not a module, or a 'zine, or even a work of speculative natural philosophy, but a bit of each, for local dabblers in exotic cosmologies and seekers after adventure in other worlds, in this case tabletop gamers - and maybe you. It's designed to transcend system, even setting.

This particular Delver's Digest is a brief guide to a weird world, with six locations described, a non-bestiary of three otherwordly beings with several more introduced, summaries of two spells or similar powers, an entry on a transtructive item, and reflections on networking by fungi and the nature of your existence, with a table for encounters, two for deigmatic growth and one for local goods - and maybe a map - all to fit one sheet, plus an intro and list of parts. Its open, amorphous nature may make it best suited to more seasoned gamers.

178205.name: Iridia (Compilation)
rpgissuearticle: #101 - Expired Meters - a game of mystery, horror and weirdness in L.A.
#103 - Caught in the Lens; A Prelude for Changeling: The Lost
#22 - This, That and the Other Thing: Not Your Average Lass
#23 - This, That and the Other Thing: A Horse is a Horse...
#25 - This, That and the Other Thing: Inn Rooms
#26 - This, That and the Other Thing: “Wagons, ho!”
#40 - This, That and the Other Thing: Hireling Quirks
#5 - The Warehouse at Piketon Way, Continued
#6 - This, That and the Other Thing: A Night at the Campfire
#61 - Actual Play: Quest of the Sorcerer King
#62 - This weekend I saw a big robot
#63 - Actual Play: Quest of the Sorcerer King
#7 - This, That, and the Other Thing: Odd Followers
#88 - The Church of Weyoun the Wanderer
#89 - The Abandonned Shrine of Weyoun the Wanderer
#92 - Madame Privett's cellar and the Sewers Beyond
#92 - The rats in Madame Privett's cellar
#92 - The Town of Gisselin and its environs
#93 - The Abandonned Shrine of Weyoun the Wanderer
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
178205.description:
A compiled PDF of all 107 issues of Iridia, produced by the author. Contains original contents in original formatting, etc., with no additional information.

Generally uses portrait orientation for issues 1 - 80, and landscape (2-up) orientation from 81+ (although this is not always the case). Predominantly black and white, occasional color in later issues.

Distributed (for free) by the author, online.

Early issues focus on AD&D, Basic D&D, and Star Frontiers. Middle editions focus on GURPS (4e), AD&D 2e, D&D 3.5. Later editions focus on Labyrinth Lord and a variety of games in less detail.

Article names are prefixed with the original issue number.

178206.name: Vindicator
178206.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unleash the fury of the vindcator base class upon your foes (or upon your players). The vindicator can improve his combat prowess with the vindication class feature, which he uses to power up most of his other abilities. This is a martial class that can focus on damaging various foes at once with the use of his sacrifice ability. Chose and pick various ardor abilities as the vindicator levels up, learn to use a two-handed weapon in only one hand, and maybe even turn your other hand into a giant claw, or cover it with various tentacles.

Be careful though, many of the vindicator’s abilities rely on his HP, you might end up accidentally falling by your own hand.

A new base class brought to you by ARMR Studios. Included in this book are feats to compliment the vindicator base class, as well as favored class options.

178207.description:
Natural Wonders! Druids have the companionship of mighty beasts and the power to call upon nature's wrath. The Druid Class Deck accessory for the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game allows players to bring these protectors of the wild to any Base Set including the demon-filled Wrath of the Righteous campaign!

The 110-card Druid Class Deck contains three new characters—including a new version of the iconic druid Lini—and enough new and familiar allies, spells, weapons, and other boons to advance your druid through an entire Adventure Path. This deck can also be used in the exciting Pathfinder Society Adventure Card Guild organized play campaign.
178207.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Class Deck – Druid
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

178208.description:
In a post-apocalyptic world where Zombies are bored, two teams of Zombies face off for the annual Epic Conga Line Showdown of Ultimate Destiny.

Two teams of Zombies will be positioning themselves to create a conga line...the zombies will need to move wisely as their opponents line may cut them off, and they'll need to address their hunger for brains by picking up some while they conga!

Each turn, players place one of their Zombies onto a 6x7 board starting from the bottom row. Each slot on the 6x7 board either gives brains, or takes away brains. The first time a player places their Zombie into a new row, it costs them brains. The first player to have four Zombies in a row, wins. The board changes every game.
178208.name: Zonga: The Epic Zombie Conga Line Showdown of Ultimate Destiny of the Apocalypse

178209.description:
Adventure Time Fluxx, as with all Fluxx card games, starts with one basic rule: Draw one card, Play one card. You start with a hand of three cards, so add the card you drew to your hand, and then choose one card to play, following the directions written on your chosen card.

As cards are drawn and played from the deck, the rules of the game change from how many cards are drawn, played or even how many cards you can hold at the end of your turn. No one can win until a Goal card sets the conditions for winning, which is typically collecting certain Keeper cards in front of you. Goals can keep changing, though, so you never know for sure how to win.

With Adventure Time Fluxx, you get to join Jake the dog and Finn the human for some ever-changing fun. Draw a card, Play a card, and change the Rules. Get Mathematical against Candy Zombies, visit the City of Thieves to steal from your friends, and maybe, if things work out just right, you might even get to Floop the Pig!
178209.name: Adventure Time Fluxx

178210.description:
Batman Fluxx, as with all Fluxx card games, starts with one basic rule: Draw one card, Play one card. You start with a hand of three cards, so add the card you drew to your hand, and then choose one card to play, following the directions written on your chosen card.

As cards are drawn and played from the deck, the rules of the game change from how many cards are drawn, played or even how many cards you can hold at the end of your turn. No one can win until a Goal card sets the conditions for winning, which is typically collecting certain Keeper cards in front of you. Goals can keep changing, though, so you never know for sure how to win.

In Batman Fluxx, crime is running amok and no one can win with Villains on the table, so put on your utility belts and leap into the fray to help Batman and his friends clean things up!
178210.name: Batman Fluxx
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Party Gamecast Reviews - Batman Fluxx from Looney Labs

178211.name: Serpents
178211.description:
User summary:
Serpents is a strategic race game with almost no luck involved. Its theme is the struggle for survival among 7 varieties of serpents. The game is played with 2-4 players.

Each player takes a postcard-sized game board that depicts a winding serpent. The serpent is divided into 26 segments, each with a number ranging from 1 to 3 (some segments have a special effect: Attack or Guard). Each player places their three tokens on three segments from the tail. The goal is to take all of the three tokens to the serpent's head.

Each turn, each player add up the numbers where their three tokens are on, and simultaneously advance one of their token segments equal to that total. If the token lands on an Attack segment, each opponent must move all of their own tokens 1 segment backward, unless they had just advanced a token to a Guard segment.

Players interact with each other by Attacking/Guarding, and each serpent has its own special ability. Each turn, each player has limited options, and they are known to all players. So players' decisions and interactions will determine the winner.

Publisher's summary:
サーペンツは2～4人用の異なる7種のヘビで生存競争を行う、運の要素がほぼ無い戦略レースゲームです。
プレイヤーは異なるヘビのコロニーとなり３つのコマのマス目に書かれて居る数字の合計を１つのコマの移動力としゴールをめざします。
マス目には攻撃やガードのマークもありプレイヤー間のインタラクションが発生します。
また各ヘビはそれぞれ固有の能力を持ち、これらの使用の見極めが重要となります。
最も早く3つのコマ全てをゴールさせた者が勝者となります。

178212.name: Treasure Mountain
178212.description:
Your dwarf clan spends all day in the mines digging up gems. But what will you do with all those gems? Will you sell them at the market for gold, offer them to the Dwarf King for rewards, or simply hoard them in your deep tunnels? Just be sure to keep your axes sharp so you will be ready when the pillaging Orcs' attack.

A simple yet strategic worker placement game with a unique "bumping" mechanic that also creatively integrates some tile laying. With multiple paths to victory, which will you choose?

178213.description:
You are the leader of a band of mercenaries funded by an employer to take control of a location and rid it of your employer's enemies.Your home is dud of a safe haven planet to which your ancestors fled from an unwinnable war. Turns out the planet's wildlife is more of a threat than the war was. Now most people are doing what they can to survive, while those few that thrive aim to mold this new world as they see fit.

Players spend currency called Clips, which is provided by controlled bases, to hire differing levels of troopers, based on the amount spent to hire, and summon them to Base Spaces they control on a hexagon girded map consisting of various different terrain types.

Players selectively draw cards from a personal deck into their hand. Players spend Clips to purchase Tier Cards and summon them from their hand of cards to a base they control. There are three tire types, Blue Tier, Green Tier, and Red Tier, each with different types of corresponding weapons and armor cards. Tire color types and sub-types determine the effectiveness of different types of weapons vs. different types of armor and vice versa. The more Tier cards of a color the player has attached to bases they control the better the items, of the matching color, they can equip from their hand to troopers.

Once players have troopers on the map they then spend movement points to maneuver their troopers around the map in an effort to defeat their opponents by utilizing terrain spaces which conceal troopers to keep their tier investments a secret, eliminating enemy troopers in combat, capturing neutral/enemy bases, stealing enemy tech, exploring dangerous ruins for lost technology that could aid their efforts, and visiting settlements which will challenge their wits and offer beneficial trading options.

Combat is initiated when a trooper attacks a target that is within range of their equipped weapon at which point an eight sided die is rolled. If the number rolled plus the level of the attacking trooper is greater than the level of the target plus any modifiers, then the attack hits and damage is calculated based on weapon and armor types and sub-types.
178213.name: Sinister Winds of Rising Dogma

178214.name: Jostle Parent
178214.description:
User Summary

Being a parent is hard. You need to get your kids up and get them ready to face the world and on top of that you need to keep them alive too.

But they never do what you want, so you'll have to jostle them to do so.

178215.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 6 - May 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Der Palast der goldenen Tiger - Der Alabaster Palast
Die Nastjorim - Die Baumzwerge von West-Meralis
178215.description:
1 Vorwort - johannes borgwardt
2 – 3 Aus den Küchen Tharpuras Christoph Daether
3 – 7 Veteranensiedlungen Daniel Löckemann
7 – 13 Die Nastjorim - Die Baumzwerge von West-Meralis - Michael Wuttke, Dieter Dengel, René Littek
12 - Der Fall von Satyrabasch
13 – 16 Götter und Geister des NordensRené Littek
16 – 20 Myranisches Aventurien René Littek
18 - Der Palast der goldenen Tiger - Der Alabaster Palast - Littek
20 – 22 Leben im Imperium – Optimatisches Vergnügen Peter Horstmann
23 – 27 Nebel über Asnarion Jörn Wesserling
28 Impressum

178216.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 7 - Aug 2005)
178216.description:
3 Vorwort - Peter Horstmann
4 Ama GirRaos Kochecke Bernadette Wunden
5 Imperiale Festtage Jörn Wesserling
8 Auguren und Orakel - Zukunfftsdeuter in Myranor - Gottfried Neuner
12 Die 100 gesichter der Optimaten - Ausbildung der Kouramnion-Offiziere Peter Horstmann
21 Cadhiaynas Lehren Jörn Wesserling
24 Bashura – Nabel des Imperiums Daniel Löckemann
29 Im Namen des Thearchen - Gott-Herrscher auf dem Sternenthron - René Littek
34 Impressum

178217.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 8 - Nov 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Leben im Imperium - Optimatisches Vergnügen II
178217.description:
3 Vorwort - Peter Horstmann
4 – 5 Ama GirRaos Kochecke Peter Horstmann
5 – 9 Erasumische Mythologie A. Kuhn
10 – 15 Leben im Imperium - Optimatisches Vergnügen II Peter Horstmann
16 – 17 Shinxo – der Archivar Marcus Coorssen
18 – 27 Wege nach Myranor – Güldenlandhandel Daniel Löckemann
28 Impressum

178219.name: Weird Science Compendium
178219.description:
From the publishers site:

From steam powered butlers to rocket propelled cars an amazing array of weird science is available to your Globetrotter!

Welcome to Professor Pennyworth’s Weird Science Emporium. Within these pages you’ll find a variety of gadgets, weapons, vehicles, and living creations designed with the aspiring globetrotter in mind. The devices follow the same format as per the core rules, giving you the information you need to create your own variants or improve existing models.

So if you’re building a moon rocket or just want to order the latest self cleaning clothes, you’ll find it in the Leagues of Adventure Weird Science Compendium.

rpgitemversion: Lankhmar: Relatos del Gremio de Ladrones PDF version
Lankhmar: Relatos del Gremio de Ladrones Physical version
178220.name: Lankhmar: Savage Tales of the Thieves Guild
178220.description:
From publisher blurb:

Steal a noble’s yacht. Get thrown out of the Silver Eel. Stop a mad god’s avatar. It's just another day in the City of Thieves...

Within this tome are fourteen Savage Tales to unleash on your wary band of rogues. Task your scoundrels to uncover the source of a mysterious red smoke plaguing the city before a guild war breaks out. Collect the Thieves’ Guild’s bounty on the notorious pirate known as "Black Skull." Or steal a holy relic out from under the watchful eyes of a rising church on the Street of Gods.

The adventures in Savage Tales of the Thieves' Guild can be played independently or interwoven into an ongoing campaign. Each brings the City of Sevenscore Thousand Smokes alive and places your players in the thick of Lankhmar’s dark alleys, shady dealings, and twisted schemes.

178221.name: The Lost Lady
178221.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lost Lady is the third in a series of one page adventures by Sacrosanct Games. They are designed with the following goals in mind:

Meant to be one-off sessions whenever something comes up that you can't do your main campaign
generic in listed stats to be compatible with most versions of the most popular RPG with little conversion needed.
a quick, low prep adventure for whenever the desire to game grabs you





keep it to only one page in length for ease of use and printing

178222.name: Battle of Thermopylae (EGS)
178222.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a distant, possible future, it’s the year 1077 AF. After more than a thousand years, the Heavenly Contest ended without a winner. Zeus resides on the throne of Olympus, but during the extenuating struggle, the gods lost much of their power and influence over the Cosmos and humans. People now rely on philosophy and reason, deserting the temples. Demigods are no longer born and less heroic deeds are regularly performed to please the gods. While the Olympians are looking for a way to regain their former influence over the Cosmos, a new rising god from the east threatens the safety of Hellas and wishes to destroy the twelve Olympians. Ahura Mazda, god of the Persians, challenges Zeus while inciting his followers to conquer the Cosmos to become its only ruler. King Xerxes, son of Darius, leads a huge army against Hellas while Ahura Mazda fights with his Daevas against the Olympians.

The Persian army is moving on Hellas; King Leonidas marches his Spartan army to the pass of Thermopylae after building an army of Hellenes. But treason is brewing, and it's up to our heroes to turn the tide. The PCs are ripped from the past and thrown into this distant future with one goal: stop the treason and rally the Hellenes to victory!

Battle of Thermopylae is an epic adventure for Mythos for 3-5 Veteran heroes. Although Mythos takes place during the time of the Heavenly Contest, the gods throw the PCs into the future to fight for Hellas and hopefully turn the tide at Thermopylae. Can they infiltrate the Persian camp and save the day?

178223.name: Crypts & Creatures Campaign Adventure: Good Deeds
178223.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let the Adventure Begin!!

Welcome to Good Deeds. This is a campaign adventure designed for four to five characters at level 1-2, whose total combined levels should be between four and eight. A dedicated healer is essential for this adventure. The difference between this book and the Dungeon Adventures series is that this is a narrated campaign story. Good Deeds was specifically designed for use with the Shaleria Campaign Setting book. The majority of this story takes place in the Crescent Lands, near Tregaron, Corinthea. After being hired to deliver a copy of the new Living Contract between Ni'Deera and Corinthea, the players find themselves caught in a deadly political game involving two counties, a quest, and a spider cult.

178224.name: Fatal Highway
178224.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a quick set of tried-and-tested rules for vehicles and vehicle chases in FATE. The original iteration of these rules can be found in Agents of SWING and aspects and versions of it can be found in other recent FATE products or fan-books I’ve written including Pacific Rim: FATE of Mankind and @ctiv8 2.0. This version contains some ideas written up for a FATE version of ‘45: Psychobilly Retropocalypse.

This booklet is all about cars, chases, crashes and some post-apocalyptic inspiration for those who want to play road warriors.

178225.name: Libram Novus #11
178225.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the eleventh issue of Libram Novus.

In this issue we bring you an alternative to the standard Combat Moves and Combat Styles found in the core Novus rules.

These alternatives also bring a host of smaller changes to the system, such as the implementation of Damage Caps, and additional weapons, and even minor changes to many classes to compensate for the new lack of Combat Moves.

178226.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 133 - Mar 2011)
rpgissuearticle: A Call to Arms: Noble Armada
Dungeons & Dragons: Fortune Cards — Shadow Over Nentir Vale
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Shandler Chronicles Chapter #33: Nocturnal Visitor
178226.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

178227.name: Walhalla: El Juego de Rol de la Plena Edad Media
178227.description:
From editor web:

Walhalla is the RPG of the High Middle Ages. For him marches the melting pot of civilizations who lived and fought in Europe, the Middle East and North Africa between the ninth and twelfth centuries. Of these, the nation of ancient Scandinavian pride of place in our manual.

De la web de los productores:

Walhalla es el juego de rol de la Plena Edad Media. Por él desfila el crisol de civilizaciones que convivieron y se enfrentaron en Europa, Próximo Oriente y Norte de África entre los siglos IX y XII. De todas ellas, la nación de los antiguos escandinavos ocupa un lugar preferente en nuestro manual.

178228.name: Alpens 1873, el joc
178228.description:
[EN]
Alpens 1873, el joc will guide you back to the 9th of July 1873 in Alpens (Catalonia) during the Third Carlist War, which opposed the Carlist troops against the Liberal army. Your villagers must find their way out of town! Don't let the soldiers stop you!

[CAT]
Alpens 1873, el joc us portarà a Alpens, el dia 9 de juliol de 1873 durant la tercera guerra carlina, que enfrontava les tropes liberals contra les tropes carlines. Els teus habitants han de fugir del poble!!! Que no t’ho impedeixin les tropes!!!

178229.description:
Are you ready to live exciting adventures in the Land of Ooo? Do you want to be in Finn’s, Jake’s, or in any of their good friend’s skin? Do you want to discover the mysteries of this magical world? Then Adventures in the Land of Ooo is the game for you! Have fun with the characters and situations of the Adventure Times show in this fun, family board game. Explore dangerous dungeons to obtain the Crystal Eye, face powerful wizards, or have a great dance with Death until the Peppermint Butler arrives.

Play with the characters from the show, like Finn, Jake or Marceline, exploring around the game board. Collect cards and objects to overcome the challenges and enemies they will have to face along the way. Finally, achieve the objective of the mission before the rest of the players to win the game...
You will have a mathematical time!

The basic game set comes with two missions, inspired on episodes from the show: "The Dungeon" and "Wizard Battle", each with their own objectives and special rules.
178229.name: Adventure Time: Adventures in the Land of Ooo

178230.name: Dagon (Issue 1 - Nov 1983)
178230.description: First issue of Dagon fanzine, presenting material for use with Call of Cthulhu. Originally printed in November, 1983, it received a second printing in November, 1984, and was later digitized and released as a PDF. The first issue was written entirely by Carl T. Ford with cover and interior art by Nick Basi.

178231.name: Honnoji
178231.description:
From the back of the box (translated):
Japan's largest coup, the Honnoji Incident, happened before dawn on June 2, 1582. Inside the burning temple, Oda Nobunaga is said to have committed suicide but his body was never found....

User description:
Honnoji uses tiles to select action locations, including movement, tile pickup, fighting, and recovery. The tiles are placed in a grid in front of the player, and the actions that happen are determined by the relative locations of the tiles.

While the temple burns, you must move your samurai through the temple, collecting treasures (tiles) and avoiding other samurai and the fire. The winner will be the player who has collected and (managed to keep) the most treasure at the end of 6 rounds.

178232.name: Wild Elven Shaman
178232.description:
From publisher blurb:

Summon the spirits of your wild elven ancestors!

With the Wild Elven Shaman, a new 11 level elven variant class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, you can play these mysterious elven race in just about any OSR game. This class introduces the wild elf, a slight twist on the normal elves in old school games, and presents a variant interpretation of the shaman class, with the elven talent for arcane magic. These elves are even more reclusive than their high elven breathren, but now you can peak into their world!

178233.name: Top That Toast
178233.description:
The party game Top That Toast consists of two decks of cards: 50 Tone Cards and 200 Topic Cards. All players begin the game by drawing 5 Topic Cards. The oldest player in the group begins as the "Facilitoaster."

The Facilitoaster begins the round by drawing a Tone Card, which determines the tone or style of the toast (some examples include "Humor," "Sincere," "Tearjerker," and "Roast"). All other players respond by submitting a Topic Card, face-down on the table. The Facilitoaster then reads the Topic Cards aloud and chooses the Topic Card that, in his or her opinion, best matches the Tone Card and deserves to be toasted. The player who submitted that Topic Card then delivers a toast and thereby wins a Tone Card for that round.

There are additional competitive aspects of the game. In the event that 2 or more of the same Topic Card is submitted in a round, the Facilitoaster has the option to call for a Toast Off, where the players who submitted the same Topic Card each give a toast. The Facilitoaster will award the Tone Card to the player who gave the best toast.

When the Top That Toast Tone Card is drawn, each player will give a toast based on the Topic Card that is selected by the Facilitoaster. Once all toasts are completed, the Facilitoaster chooses which player is awarded the Tone Card.

After each round, the role of the Facilitoaster rotates around the table. Once a player has won a pre-determined number of Tone Cards, that player wins the game!

178234.name: Celtic Bard
178234.description:
From publisher blurb:

Challenge your foes with charm, lore, and blade!

With the new Celtic Bard class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, you can play bards who are more closely based on the original bard as presented in the first advanced edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game, without all the complications and fiddly mechanics. These masters of epic lore can fend for themselves, enchant their foes, and draw upon a smattering of druidic mysteries. Add them to just about any OSR game!

178235.name: Scout
178235.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spy on your foes, and cut them down before they know you are there!

Scouts are a new class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord. Walking a line between rangers and thieves, the scout gather's vital intel on foes before hitting them where it hurts most. Add this class to just about any OSR game!

178236.name: Game of Thrones -  Episode 4: Sons of Winter
videogameseries: Game of Thrones - A TellTale Game Series
178236.description:
The fate of the scattered Forresters hangs in the balance, and no one allied with the family is safe. An unexpected meeting offers Rodrik a new opportunity to free Ironrath from its Whitehill stranglehold, but with young Ryon Forrester still held prisoner, his next moves are critical. Gared must abandon Castle Black and venture beyond the Wall in search of the mysterious North Grove, risking encounters with Wildlings and worse. In King's Landing, the population is reeling from a recent royal death, and Mira must step carefully in an increasingly complex game of politics where secrets are traded as currency.

Source: The Developer Website.

178237.name: Bone Pit
178237.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 253rd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a dungeon room with sacrificial altar and a bone pit.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2880 pixels in size at 144dpi.

178238.name: Caradoc's Medallion
178238.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first adventure for the Eldritch Revised Edition. Parts of the scenario were originally seen in the 1st Edition Quickstart Guide, now updated with new encounters and plot points, plus changes reflecting integration with the world of Ainerêve. Also includes alternative character sheet and pregen characters for demos. Play time about two hours.

178239.name: Chip Up!
178239.description: Chip Up! is the fast-playing dice game that will have you stealing stacks of chips from your opponents or from the pot! Roll the dice to reveal which chip colors are fair game and whose chips are at risk. Play it safe by banking chips when you have the chance, or push your luck to add to your stack instead. When the pot is empty, the game is over and the tallest stack wins!

178240.description:
These five cards are a promotional item from the publisher. They include alternate artwork for each of the five Bet cards included in the Tales & Games: The Hare & the Tortoise game. They are meant as an optional replacement for the original Bet cards, not something to be used additionally.

Each of the five cards has art by a different artist.
178240.name: Tales & Games: The Hare & the Tortoise – Alternate Bet Cards
boardgameexpansion: Tales & Games: The Hare & the Tortoise

178241.name: No Quarter (Issue 41 - Mar 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Gen Con P3 Grandmaster Painting Competition Rules
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Captain Jeremiah Kraye
The Kalmieri: The Saga of Horfar Grimmr
Tipping the Scales of War: Designing Colossals
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178241.description: Issue 41 includes material on Iron Kingdoms role playing game.

178242.name: Vampire: The Dark Ages (20th Anniversary Edition)
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
178242.description:
From publisher blurb:

The year is 1242. The Mongol army crushed Baghdad and then Russia under its heel, and then moved on to devastate Poland and Hungary. The Holy Roman Empire stood to war with the Papacy. The second Lombard League wielded the word of the Pope and fought off Frederick II.

The vampire War of Princes rages. Patricide looms. Young powers look up the ladder to the next rungs, and see stagnation and hypocrisy. They see targets. When they look down, they see humanity. They see a power that could change everything. They see mortals organizing into universities and empires.

In the mortal world of 1242, power shifted at the rate an army marched. For the undead, power shifts faster than a fire overtakes a haven. To the Damned, power flows as fast as blood from an ancient heart.

Vampire 20th Anniversary: The Dark Ages is a storytelling game of horrific power.

What You'll Find Inside

Thirteen vampire clans, and nineteen bloodlines.
All three castes of the dying Salubri: the Warriors, the Watchers, and the Healers.
Bloodlines from every edition of Vampire, and from all over the known world.
A new approach to Tzimisce Koldunic Sorcery.
An "apocrypha of the clans" featuring fiction, lore, Roads, and alternative castes within the clans of Caine.
A complete game in one book, which does not require Vampire 20th Anniversary Edition.
New full color original art by Mark Kelly, Kieran Yanner, Brian Syme, Andrew Trabbold, and other fantastic artists, as well as a handful of classic B&W pieces carefully chosen from the earlier editions.

178243.name: No Quarter (Issue 42 - May 2012)
rpgissuearticle: The Gavyn Kyle Files: Karchev the Terrible
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178243.description:
Released as print and PDF versions simultaneously.

Includes Iron Kingdoms RPG walkthrough.

178244.name: Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon – Glory of Macragge
178244.description:
At the climactic moment of the 2nd War for Armageddon, three Space Marine chapters descend from the skies above to aid the beleaguered defenders of Hiveworld Armageddon. Now take control of the Ultramarines and re-live their contribution to this epic confrontation in a brand new campaign for Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon.

This campaign features 11 all new missions organized into three Acts that follow the exploits and heroic deeds of the Ultramarines during the 2nd War for Armageddon. Earn the favour of your fellow Space Marine Chapters or dare to go it alone as you battle once again to drive the Ork invaders from Hiveworld Armageddon!

This campaign is an expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon and requires Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon to be played

Source: The Publisher Website.

178245.name: Cube Slam
178245.description:
User Summary

Cube Slam is a Chrome Experiment that you can play face-to-face against your friends, just by sharing a link in Chrome. It's built using WebRTC, an open web technology that lets you video chat right in the browser without installing any plug-ins.

178246.name: Bogstav Rebus
178246.description: A dice game, where players roll 13-15 dice with letters on them, and within a limited amount of time, try to make words and get the most points. The winner is the player with the most points.

178247.name: Krydsord
178247.description: A word game, where players have to place letter tiles on a board to create words, trying to achieve more points than the opponent.

178248.name: Honningtyven
178248.description: The goal of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all their pieces. Players will roll a dice with five different colors on the sides, and search the board for a bear with the appropriate color. If the player is right, he may get rid of one of his pieces, but will have to take one if he is wrong.

178249.name: Tranzar's Redoubt
178249.description:
[From the cover]

Every fool knows that a cornered conjurer is a most dangerous foe. But a truly wise wizard will always have a fallback plan to use when victory eludes him. A secret place cached with treasure, filled with monsters and guarded by dweomercraft most subtle is the defeated magician’s best friend. It is also a juicy plum for professional adventurers. Care to take a bite?

a labyrinth lord adventure for 4 - 8 characters of level 4 - 6

178251.description:
Two bonus cards for use with BANG!: Halo.

Gravity Hammer: Can only be blocked by discarding 2 Hardlight Shields

Energy Sword: If you damage a player with this, return it to your hand instead of discarding it.
178251.name: BANG!: Halo – Gravity Hammer & Energy Sword

178252.name: BANG!: Heroes of the Storm – Frostmourne & Brightwing
178252.description:
Two bonus cards for use with BANG!: Heroes of the Storm.

Frostmourne - When you play a BANG!, regain one bullet.

Brightwing - At the end of your turn, you may have any player regain one bullet.

178253.name: BANG!: The Walking Dead – Lucille & Katana
178253.description:
Two bonus cards for use with BANG!: The Walking Dead.

Lucille - An a successful attack, the injured player loses 2 Health.

Katana - When you play an attack, draw a card from the deck.

178255.description:
Four pizzerias, four city districts and four groups of starving customers… It is here, where Gill Bates created his Micropizzas while listening to Jack Michaelson singing “Eat it”. It is also here where the world-famous scientist, Stevie Falconing, is looking for holes in dough and Beat Oven composed his Grosse Funghi…

Pizza Wars PL is a hilarious game for both children and adults in which you take over as an owner of one of four pizzerias and you compete with others, trying to pay the credit off, taken to set up your business. With every baked pizza, you are one step closer to achieve your target..!
Will you meet all your customers’ needs or will you rather meet… a debt collector..?

In Pizza Wars PL, you run a pizzeria in one of four districts of the city Margherita. These are:

business district,
bohemian,
villa
district of poverty.




There are 15 unique customers (customer cards) originating from each of them (a total of 60). Each player starts with a different game board and some money.
As an owner of the premises in a given social background you possess a special feature (fixed bonus) helping you to serve guests from your neighbourhood. During the game you can also acquire an extra piece of equipment:

fridge
oven
trolley
table
“connections”




These increases your chance of victory and modify the strategy.

Each customer requires a pizza with particular ingredients that you have to acquire to bake (cards of ingredients). You may buy them from the market place (on display) or draw randomly for free from the deck. After each round the market place changes (ingredients rot).

There are as many turns as players and within your turn there are also two phases:

you may either collect new ingredients or bake a pizza,
pay your credit off (move on the board) or acquire a piece of equipment.




You can have a maximum of 2 customers and 6 ingredients (some bonuses can change this rule) on hand.

Having baked a pizza, your customer pays you some money, one’s card is discarded and you compulsorily draw a new customer – you may decide if you want one from your own district or from the common deck. The money you earn has to be spent on new ingredients and on a rate of the credit. The player who pays the credit off as first, wins the game.

There is an extra set of easier rules for younger children.
178255.name: Pizza Wars PL

178256.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 9 - Feb 2006)
rpgissuearticle: Leben im Imperium - Balathandis – Schenk mir Kraft!

178260.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 13 - Feb 2007)
rpgissuearticle: Kraft durch Einheit - Der Kult des Shinxir
Myranische Reit-, Zug- und Lasttiere I
178260.description:
3 Vorwort - Horstmann
4 Die Pudeos René Littek
