41 Impressum

178261.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 79 - May 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Random Thought Table: Awe's Right With the World
The SkipTime Hub of the OceanWe
178261.description:
Space Atlas

From the Publisher:

Getting Out of Your System!

If you've got a spaceship, you likely want to leave our solar system and travel to new worlds. This month's Pyramid -- the PDF magazine for roleplayers -- can help by providing new planets to explore and ways to get there! This passport to the unknown includes:


"Ostara," a colony of outcast Earth troublemakers who have turned into something else, thanks to a psionic-inducing plague. Presented by David L. Pulver (co-author of GURPS Bio-Tech), this setting features the planet's history, situation, and GURPS stats for its oft-dangerous native life.
"The Vanishing Sun," detailing an entire solar system that somehow ensnares ships. Christopher R. Rice describes this enigma's backstory, its system features, a new GURPS template for the curious Quicksilver-Born, plus adventure and crossover ideas for bringing this challenge into your campaign.
"The SkipTime Hub of the OceanWe," a new systemless alien culture that's willing to bestow slivers of their precognitive abilities for a bit of culture.
"Halfway to Anywhere," an in-depth look at calculating the delta-V required to traverse between worlds. Use its formulas (or the included spreadsheet) to maneuver from planet to planet in the best hard-science tradition. Rely on Hohmann transfers, gravity slingshots, and other maneuvers or techniques to make the most efficient use of your limited resources. And its calculations are all fully compatible with GURPS Space and the GURPS Spaceships series!
"Homeward Unbound," an intriguing new way for a person to travel across the galaxy almost instantaneously . . . even if the trip back is more challenging.


This month's Pyramid also delivers a Random Thought Table that looks at building interplanetary mysteries, plus an Odds and Ends with more goodness we couldn't fit elsewhere in the issue. With this issue of Pyramid, the gate to the heavens is open!

178262.name: Technobabylon
178262.description:
User Summary

An old-school point-and-click adventure with a cyberpunk theme.

178263.name: Auktionshuset
178263.description:
An auction game based on the tv series of the same name. You bid on a number of real-life objects (each on a card), hopefully buying things much cheaper than the amount hidden on the cards.

The game ends when one player has won five auctions or purchased stuff for DKK 999,900.

178264.name: Devious Dungeon
178264.description:
Devious Dungeon is a medieval action platforming game by the creators of Random Heroes and League of Evil!

The catacombs under the Kingdom are infested with evil creatures. You must venture deep within the dungeons eliminating the threat! Slay monsters, collect loot, level up and upgrade your gear.

Only a true champion will be victorious!

Features
- Level randomization
- 5 worlds
- Slay monsters and collect loot!
- Lots of weapons and gear
- RPG styled upgrades
- Boss Battles
- Mission system
- Achievements

Source: The Publisher Website.

178265.name: You Are a Shark
178265.description:
From the back of the Book:
Your hike through Nepal leads you into a forbidden temple. As punishment for your intrusion, you must survive in the forms of several different animals in order to earn your freedom.

178266.description:
Fate of Akalon: Tribes is a 2-4 player combat card game set on the dying continent of Akalon. Players control a tribe of fantasy races in a struggle for survival. Each turn a player will play a card to the battlefield and compare combat values. The winner's card goes to their discard pile, the loser's card to that players cemetery. The winner is the first player to send 30 points worth of combat value to their opponent's cemetery. Each race's deck contains unique thematic powers to influence the combat values when played.

Fate of Akalon: Tribes is a quick, thematic card game that surprises with depth of play belying its simple mechanisms.
178266.name: Fate Of Akalon: Tribes

178267.name: Clan of the Raven
178267.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quoth the Raven...

Animal Races: Clan of the Raven presents a new, customizable variant of the tengu race. These shapechanging humanoids can assume the forms of various birds, from ravens and songbirds to falcons and parrots, and retain their bird-like faces when in humanoid form. Shunned for their traditional association with psychopomps and death, these tengus lurk on the edges of the civilized world.

Play a clever scavenger, a gifted linguist, a sword-trained hero, or an oracle of the mysterious Phantom Queen. Learn feats to improve your shapechanging capabilities or magically scold your foes. Collect shiny objects and other random trinkets for fun and profit. If all else fails, join a Parrot on a pirate ship. There need never be a dull moment in the life of a Raven.

178268.name: The Curse of Egypt
178268.description:
From publisher blurb:

FROM THE ANCIENT TOMBS, IT RISES...

The Curse of Egypt features three classic horror shorts (one illustrated by the great Steve Ditko) that draw their inspiration from the legends and iconic cursed tombs and mummies of Egypt. Each relates a chilling tale of the ancient mystical forces of Egypt colliding with and crushing those of the modern world.

In addition, In addition to the comics, The Curse of Egypt contains new rules to let roleplaying gamers create their own chilling tales of ancient evils awakened using the d20 System. With a series of feats, player characters and non-player characters alike can bring the touch of the ancient gods of Egypt to campaigns where the supernatural is uncommon. Designed by Steve Miller, known for his work on the Ravenloft gothic fantasy gameworld, these rules are fully compatible with other NUELOW Games d20 System supplements and easily incorporated into your favorite d20 System variant. (They were designed with the OGL d20 Modern game in mind.)

178269.name: The High Stones are Quay to the World
178269.description:
From publisher blurb:

A drizzly moorland. Its rain-soaked slopes are crowned by clusters of colossal standing stones among which prancers commune as brayers circle unnerved. Lichenids heed.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted moorland as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including inhabitants, behaviours, landscape features, a subtle network and a possible arrival.

Brayers also feature in The Ferrous Thicket.

178270.name: Volcano God and the Dying Sun
178270.description:
From publisher blurb:

Volcano God is a story roleplaying game about the final days of a forgotten tribe. Unaware of their impending doom, the tribe continues to sacrifice its people to the Volcano God in an attempt to appease the unquiet spirit within… until the tribe is no more. Characters are important members of the tribe living under the shadow of the Volcano God, doing everything they can to abate the inevitable end rushing toward them.

Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

178271.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume XVI
178271.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the game of Pathfinder, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume XVI, and its predecessors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 21 mythic spells, from programmed image to remove curse. A mythic programmed image gains a limited sentience, and can use its own reasoning, judgment, and knowledge to act out your commands. The mythic version of protection from energy can absorb the power of the elements it protects from, using them to create further defenses, and can also protect from all the elements at once. A mythic rage allows you to grant rage powers to the targets, or cause unwilling creatures to fly into a self-destructive frenzy, while a mythic reincarnate can bring creatures back as creatures of completely different types. This tome contains all that, and much, much more!

178272.name: The Path to Odill
178272.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure and fortune doesn’t always simply arrive on the footsteps of heroes. And it isn’t reserved for the frontier. Odill is the only true city for hundreds of miles. Once it was a reliable civilizing influence, but over the current Prince’s reign it has degenerated into a den of debauchery – cults, slavery, sadism, narcotics... There seems to be no bounds to Odill’s corruption. Can heroes bring hope to such a city in such despair? The journey to Odill is not likely to be uneventful. A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition adventure for 1-8 5th level characters. This is the first episode of the Orcus in Odill Saga.

178273.name: Roguish Archetype: Ninja Warrior
178273.description:
From publisher blurb:

Peak Physical Condition: the Art of Taijutsu

Ninjas area freaking crazy! Executing Combat Maneuvers left & right... Jumping in & out of stealth, never where you expect them. Freaking out with dual-wielded swords & throwing shuriken everywhere! They don't even stay on the ground like normal people. No, they fly around on those weird Kaginawa things!

Become the ultimate master of dual-wielding!
Scale buildings & fly through the air with your Kaginawa grappling hook!
10 new Combat Maneuvers for ninja warriors, battle master fighters, or any other character that has access to the combat superiority class feature!

178274.name: Tsunami Quarterly Review (Issue 10 - Spring 2015)
178274.description:
From publisher blurb:

In our tenth issue of Tsunami Quarterly Review, you will find the following great features:

RPG Crucible: Chasing the Dragon: Explore characterization through vice as a roleplaying tool.
Will You Pay the Price?: The Radiating Gnome continues his exploration of 4E skill challenges with a custom toolset for developing exciting noncombat scenarios.
Changing the Ride: JiB explores the fine art of revisiting old adventures with different game systems.
Patrons of the Heavens: This issue's article for the Tsunami Living Campaign provides a pantheon of deities tied to events in the world and available for GMs to use as they see fit.
The Mortlock, Pt 3: Jonikka Frazier presents another chapter in the story of Sharia Mortlock in the time before the events of the Obsidian Crown Actual Play adventure.




Tsunami Quarterly Review is a companion publication for the Prismatic Tsunami web community and its podcast partner, Metagamers Anonymous. The magazine expands on the Tsunami's mission statement by offering gaming advice from community contributors and focusing on popular features from the podcast, particularly the Tsunami Living Campaign.

178275.name: Goblin Feats
178275.description:
From publisher blurb:

Goblin Feats brings you 12 mythic feats for your hideous and horrible humanoids, the deranged yet dangerous goblins and their far more serious and sinister hobgoblin kin! Unleash your goblin rage with feats from Fire Tamer to Terrorizing Display and Taskmaster to Burn! Burn! Burn!

178276.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 134 - Apr 2011)
rpgissuearticle: All's Fair in Carrots and War
BattleLore: Battles of Westeros from Fantasy Flight Games
Pathfinder Campaign Setting World Guide: The Inner Sea (Revised Edition)
The Lord of the Rings LCG: Shadows of Mirkwood
The Shandler Chronicles Chapter #34: The Star of Unseen Stars
178276.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

178277.name: No Happy Endings
178277.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to No Happy Endings, the newest setting for the Adventurers RPG!

Welcome to the world of fairytales... gone wrong! After the storybook villains, fed up with losing eternally, sealed the happy endings away, the world needs to be fixed. Kingdoms bleed in stupid wars, neighboring states combine the powers of sorceresses with a budding Industrial Revolution, and ogres and demons roam the countryside! Only brave heroes, wise sorceresses, cunning tricksters, noble knights or talking animals can fix the fairy tales.

Note: This isn't a stand-alone game! You also need the Adventurers! core rules.

In this setting you'll find:

24 new monsters, from peasant devils to mighty giants and The Dragon!
A set of weird kingdoms to save and defeat
Rules for black powder weapons and weird inventions
A set of rules for roleplaying talking animals like ravens, toads or wolves!
Six pregenerated heroes
An adventure in the haunted forest, featuring Goldie and her three talking hench-bears

178278.name: Voodoo Pirates
178278.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avast, ye landlubbers! Jump aboard Voodoo Pirates, the fifth Adventurers! setting!

In this swashbuckling game, daring adventurers will look for fortune and fame on the Cursed Spanish Main, where European navies battle for supremacy, Voodoo sorcerers incite slaves to revolt, dreaded Ghost Ships haunt the seas, and great treasures are buried on uncharted
islands inhabited by hungry headhunters and guarded by the mysterious Merfolk. Flashing blades and roaring guns are daily issues, but in the Cursed Caribbean taunts and witty jokes are an adventurer's best weapon!

Note: This isn't a stand-alone game! You also need the Adventurers! core rules.

In this game you'll find:

A complete description of the Cursed Caribbean, including a gazetteer for the GM and many important personalities of the golden age of sail.
10 dashing character concepts for this swashbuckling setting
A new Power Sphere: Necromancy! Turn zombies away or send them to fight against the Spanish oppressor!
Easy rules for handling naval battles and replacing a severed limb with a weapon, making your adventurer even tougher than before!
New and modified skills to customize your own sea-dog.
New gear for hardy seafarers and daring explorers.




As always, in 2 PAGES (+extras)!
Special Bonus

Captain Beaky - a swashbuckling adventure in two pages
Six pregen heroes, ready to dive into adventure!
32 brand new Creature Cards, including 23 new creatures, 4 Ship Templates, 3 Fortress Templates and 2 Sea Monsters!

178279.name: Gothica
178279.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this game the players explore the misty lands of the County of Gothica, battling ancient evils sneaking out from musty tombs, while strange, unholy beasts howl at the full moon. Grab your black powder pistol and your rapier, wear your tabard and don’t forget to bring your silver cross, you'll need it!

Note: It isn't a stand along game! You need the Adventurers! core rules.

In this game you'll find:

A complete description of the dark land of Gothica, including a gazetteer for the GM
Characters idea for this romantic era
Rules for handling sanity and to drive the characters in the steep path of madness
Three new skills
New gear




As always, in 2 PAGES!
Special Bonus

Night of Terror - A full adventure in two pages
Four Pregen heroes
28 new creatures on Creature Cards

178280.name: The Dawn of Tomorrow
178280.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome in The Dawn of Tomorrow, the second Adventurers! setting!

In this setting the players are thrown into a post-apocalyptic Earth, where the air is filled with thick dust and dangerous forests cover the surface of the world. Mutated creatures and the unforgiving environment try in every way to destroy the plague called Mankind. As cunning scavengers, mighty forest warriors and feared mutants they must survive and make the last light of civilization shine dimly for one more day... are you ready to face the challenge?

In this game you'll find:

A complete setting description
Hints and ideas for character types, new powers, maladies, vehicle rules and much more
Two new skills
New gear
24 new creatures/vehicles on Creature Cards




Special Bonus

The Guardian of Tomorrow - A full adventure in two pages
Six Pregen heroes




As always, all in 2 PAGES!

178281.name: Dark Camelot
178281.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome Adventurers in Dark Camelot, the first Adventurers! setting!

King Arthur lays in his deathbead, severely wounded, Excalibur was stolen and Merlin the Mage disappeared.
The kingdom is in turmoil; Saxon marauders, Pictish barbarians and robber barons are only the smaller problem: strange, dark things are leaving their hideouts in Faerie to hunt the poor villagers in their houses.

In this setting you take the role of gallant knights, wise enchanters and even bold commoners, united by the goal of saving Britain from the impending doom.
Are you ready to face Dark Camelot?

In this game you'll find:

A complete setting description
Hints and ideas for character types suitable to medieval Britain
Two new skills
New gear
24 new creatures on Creature Cards




Special Bonus

The Madness of Sir Richard - A full adventure in two pages
Four Pregen heroes

178282.description:
All Gods Are Dying is a strategic board game about the true nature of religions

Earth is the planet of our evolution. The home of all mankind and all of it’s imaginary creations, the so called „Gods”. These things can elicit such emotions in humans that make them able to willingly do literally anything. Churches are organizations created to control and use these emotions. They nourish the delusion and work for their owners’ greed. Atheists are free fighters against Gods.

Every player leads a religion. Religion deceives with light but good things are all available by secular ways. Delusion, oppression flow from religion. Missionaries collect money and convert people. The aim is to make more money, to level-up the religion, to reach the highest level and power over all others.

There are three different kind of areas in the game where religion’s missionaries can get money from believers. City, country, and playground - because some religions like to use children for their purposes. Values are depending on the religion’s nature and popularity in the area.

You start the game on the first level. By collecting enough money you level-up your religion in greed. By successfully finishing a mission you level-up your religion in spirituality. On player's board numbers show bonus points or penalties valid at that level. That value influences the collected money and the power to convert as well.

Four kinds of levels are to go through from white to red. With different colors new action cards and mission cards become available. Level-up by money becomes more expensive. You have five cards in the game, action and mission cards mixed. You have three cards hidden with face down. And you have to show openly the other two.

You may do the following in your turn:

Roll the dice and move your followers (the pieces)
Get your money from your followers
Or convert other player’s follower
Use an action card and draw another one – action or mission card
And may accomplish one of your missions




Or, if you don’t like your cards

You may replace up to three of them.




Your aims are

to reach the top level of greed,
to reach the top level of spirituality.




Depending on the game style you may win by reaching the top level, or beating others.
178282.name: All Gods Are Dying

178283.name: Pocket and Biscuit
178283.description:
Pocket and Biscuit is a game of collecting delicious cookies. Tiles are laid face down (pocket showing) in a 6x6 grid, and players must find the cookies they want to eat. If you start by finding a single cookie, then two, then even three or more, your cookies can add up, but you always have to put something back in your pocket for later.

Players take turns finding cookies until someone's pockets are full, at which point the person with the most cookies wins.

178284.name: Takoashi University: Culture Club
178284.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

178285.description:
What if the power to grant life was used on the best parts of the world’s most infamous monsters? What if you knew this secret? Would you make the world a better place, or just a better place … for you?

Dicenstein lets you dig up body parts, use them to build a monster, then use that monster to attack your rivals’ monsters, all the while assembling a monster army for world domination. It features heaps of dice rolling and constant decision-making to better your monster and your parts collection. You have to balance creating your monster army (which means spending body parts) with creating the best monster possible (which means hoarding monster parts).

The monsters are constructed by rolling monster part dice and assembling them onto a slab in your lab. Each monster has its own unique ability - combine multiple monsters to get more abilities!
178285.name: Dicenstein
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 18: The One About New Bedford

178286.name: Borderlands of the Unknown
178286.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the currently funded Perilous Journeys Kickstarter

An adventure for Freebooters on the Frontier, by Jonathan Walton! A pared-down take on the classic wilderness exploration adventure modules of the late 70s and early 80s, written to suit the harsh world of Freebooters.

Other Notes from Jason Lutes

Borderlands of the Unknown is a working title at this point, but RPG fans of a certain age will immediately recognize it as a reference to both Keep on the Borderlands and In Search of the Unknown, two influential adventure modules published by TSR in 1979. Jonathan is drawing on these, along with a variety of other sources, as he crafts an adventure that will utilize the systems laid out in both Freebooters on the Frontier and Perilous Journeys.

Jonathan is a prolific game designer whose best-known product in Dungeon World circles is probably the Planarch Codex, a modular toolkit rich with great ideas for any GM (and currently available as a free pdf or print-on-demand book). The "Dungeons as Monsters" section of the Codex was the main inspiration for my handling of improvised dungeons in Perilous Journeys, and in general Jonathan's work has helped me think laterally when it comes to design, so I feel extra-honored to have him on board as a contributor.

178287.name: No Quarter (Issue 43 - Jul 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Modeling & Painting Quick Tips: Battered & Splattered
Tales of the Iron Kingdoms: Inner Sanctum
The Armory: Protectorate of Menoth & Trollbloods
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Captain Gunnbjorn
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178287.description: Released as print and PDF versions. Includes information on the Iron Kingdoms RPG monster guide.

178288.name: No Quarter (Issue 44 - Sep 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Modeling & Painting Quick Tips: Freehand Faction Symbols
Quick Shot Scenario: Spirit in Steel
The Armory: Retribution of Scyrah and Skorne
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Dawnlord Vyros
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178288.description:
Released as print and PDF versions.
Includes an adventure for the Iron Kingdoms RPG

178289.name: The Leviathan's Tomb
178289.description:
Publisher blurb:

For the 5th edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game!

An ambitous [sic] lord scrambles to reclaim his family's keep, a fortress of solid iron that rises from a storm tossed sea. The true nature of the keep has been lost to time, but an ancient evil stirs beneath the waves. Will you brave flooded dungeons, face brutal sea monsters, and outwit the masters of the Leviathan's Tomb?

178290.name: Norsk Galskap
178290.description:
This is a game full of humoristic streaks, Norwegian myths, sensations and celebrities.

In Norsk Galskp (=Norwegian Madness) you win if you are the first player to travel from start through to finish, but on the way you have to do funny tasks that will bring out your true inner madness.In this game you can get the ability to send your opponents into a 4 second slow motion state, draw cards to make the others pick invisible apples from the ceiling every time you shout "apple-picking", or maybe you are the one who has to improvise a "Joik"(=Sami song) whilst the other players clap a beat?

If you bring Norsk Galskap to the check-out till, you're not just buying a game, but moments filled with both madness and laughter. Norsk Galskap takes but 20 seconds to learn, and will make holidays, cabin-trips and Friday nights into stories and events that might never be forgotten.

178291.name: Demons' Stories
178291.description:
From publisher blurb:

Demon~marked is a Role Playing Game set in the fantastic world of Grama. It’s built to be a low-magic and dark-fantasy kind of game, although it has a serious touch of epic-fantasy in it, since the Players will impersonate a Demon~marked. Demon~marked is a game for two players: one Player will impersonate the Character (the Demon~marked) while the other will be the Master, running the game mechanics, the world events, all NPCs etc. in a classic RPG way.

This module contains:

two new pregenerated Demon~marked characters
three Dark Overlords (the main enemies for the Demon~marked characters) with several Chaos creatures to use in the adventures
three quick-start situations for your adventures
a few game-play examples
a special bonus character

178292.name: The Evolved Path
178292.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evolution. Change. Progress.

Sometimes looking back helps move us forward. Tim Wallace has taken some of the best open game content from previous editions of this game and brought them forward into the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

In this book Tim updates some of his favorite Monte Cook creations, specifically races and classes from the wildly popular Arcana Evolved as well as some feats that were never updated for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

Just as with most other d20pfsrd.com Publishing products, at the end of this book you’ll find some “bonus” content- rules and mechanics from products created by other publishers that is complimentary to the content of this product.

WHAT’S INSIDE?

Races: This chapter introduces dracha, faen, giants, litorians, mojh, sibeccai, and verrik as new playable races. In addition, many of the new races include new racial equipment or special racial feats or spells..
Classes: This chapter presents the Akashic and Runeblade classes, as well as rules for Runic weapons.
Feats: This chapter includes twenty-one feats that were created for a previous edition of the game but which have not as yet been updated to the rules of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.
Bonus Content: The bonus content for this product includes stuff for faen and giants. The content was originally created by Total Party Kill Games and Rogue Genius Games, specifically in the Feybinder and the Gruesome Guide to Giants products.

178293.name: Plastic Hearts: Tetsujin
178293.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Plastic Hearts subline is the brainstorm of John Picot and takes Black Tokyo in new, high-tech, cyberpunk directions. It’s a vision of this unique campaign world colored by sci-fi and cyberpunk elements- a robo-fetish present or future for Black Japan.

The Tetsujin are a race of artificially intelligent robots, originally constructed for ultra-heavy labor and the dangerous jobs that humans were unwilling to perform. Due to the need for a high functioning intelligence to carry out complex tasks, the Tetsujin were given a sophisticated neural network AI to enable them to learn from mistakes and improve task management.

The first Tetsujin rolled off the assembly line during the early 1980s, and alongside the Famicom and VCR, became one of the iconic technologies of the eighties. The Tetsujin first prototypes were comparative simpletons, with crude armatures and limited vocabularies, that still none the less cost millions of dollars. These first robots went to work in factories, mines and the fields of large, corporate owned farms, displacing human laborers. Then military models, with improved AI and more complex chassis emerged. Then, when the first POETICA hit the market, refinements to the Tetsujin operating system to make their personalities more well rounded and naturalistic emerged. Soon enough, prices fell enough that wealthy families could afford a Tetsujin gardener, chauffeur or bodyguard.

By the 1990s, Tetsujin minds were complex and agile enough the cleverest could be considered almost human. By the turn of the millennia, the same activists that were just beginning to push for POETICA and catgirl emancipation were calling for Tetsujin liberty.

The difference- the Tetsujin got their freedom, albeit with some strings attached. The POETICA and Nekomusume races are still struggling in their soft bondage. Why? Because the diversified mega-corp that created the first Tetsujin prototypes wanted it that way.

178294.name: Die lustige Kletterstange
178294.description: Simple roll-and-move-game. The first player to reach space 28 wins the game. By the roll of an even number, the player moves forward. If the player rolls an odd number, he has to move backward.

178296.name: Blades in the Dark Quick Start Guide
178296.description:
From the Introduction:

This quick start gives you the basics so you can start playing Blades before the final game is released. By definition, it's missing some pieces, particularly some instructional text and examples as well as the full guide to Duskwall city which will be in the final game. As such, it's a document that you'll have to interpret and bolster with your own understanding of roleplaying practices. If you're brand-new to RPGs, maybe ask a more experienced friend to run this for you.

User Summary: This Quick Start Guide (currently on v4), as of November 2, 2015, is only available to Kickstarter Backers.

178297.name: Subtle is Their Song in the Throats of the Earth
178297.description:
From publisher blurb:

A riddled plain. Intricate song carries over the lips of its sinkholes from settlements strung within, above the river clamouring in the depths. Slinkers shrink back. Discord grows.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted plain as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including dwellers, eyries, a mineral-rich river, warrens and song distortion.

The river could be detailed using Elaboration: Atmosphere & Liquid, and the network including the warrens simplified or extended using one or more of the maps in the Location, Landscape & World bundle, not least The Livid Run.

178298.name: Swinemole's School of Sorcery for Young Sorcerers and Sorceresses
rpgseries: RPG Geek Fiasco Playset Contest 2015: Mythical / Supernatural
178298.description:
(From inside the playset)

Swinemole’s is the most prestigious magical school in the southern hemisphere. It’s also the only magical school in the southern hemisphere. The buildings may look like a concrete 1970s tragedy, and the administration may desperately cling to European traditions in order to create some façade of respectability, but the real treasure of Swinemole’s is its burnt out, bitter staff, and its appalling and apathetic students.

Firstly, the staff can’t be bothered to teach. Why would they when you have petty staffroom politics to keep you busy? Fighting over temporary positions, stationary and classroom furniture is what keeps the wheel of magical academia turning. Staff, like students, will be a member of one of the four houses (Phlegm, Blood, Gall, Bile) and assigned to a faculty (constantly changing, possibly meaningless). There’s also a lot of pointless paperwork and potentially fatal workplace hazards for the unwary educator at Swinemole’s, so keep sharp and trust no one.

Secondly, the students are indulged, indolent and incompetent. Why try when you have connections? Bad grades can always be fixed by mummy wielding a killing curse in the front office. So students wisely use their time to create the social hierarchies that will hopefully serve them for a lifetime. Fatness curses, love potions and endangered animal sacrifices are the bread and butter of magical teens in a magical school; just make sure you get to the end of the school year in one piece.

So as you wantonly grasp for power, prestige and/or potions, keep in mind the proud and mostly legal traditions of Swinemole’s, and disregard the school’s insipid motto “si post fata venit gloria non propero" (or if you prefer English) “If glory comes after death, I can wait”.

178299.name: Jupiter Jump
178299.description:
Being propelled from the force of your crashed ship, all you can do is tap to increase your gravity and slam down to the surface. Avoid the mines and bank as many points as you can. However there is a catch. If you can get close enough to the mines without blowing yourself to bits, you will get a near miss bonus that increases your score multiplier.

The higher your multiplier, the better your score, but the better chance you might end up as tiny bits of space junk. It is classic risk vs reward and incredibly addictive. There are also portals to new worlds that might even provide you with a bit of a bonus if you can get there.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178300.name: Brickies
178300.description:
Brickies is a fresh take on the classic breakout game, with fast paced levels that will leave you thirsty for more action.

Use the paddles to launch the ball and unleash a variety of power ups upon the brickies, but don’t worry if you miss the ball!
In Brickies missing a shot doesn’t mean the game is over, it deactivates the ball until you bounce it again and then you’re back in action!

Explode, shoot and cut your way through over one hundred levels featuring, action, puzzles and tricky bosses. Unlock new exciting powers as you progress through the levels, beat the timer and collect three stars.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178301.name: Sunburn!
178301.description:
You control the captain of a spaceship that is suddenly struck by a comet and destroyed. With no way to get home, the ship’s crew is forced to face reality. They’re doomed to die. There’s no way out. But no matter what their fate may be, one thing is decided for certain. No one dies alone.

It’s your job to navigate through the universe as the captain and reunite your crew. Hop, blast, and drift your way from planet to planet using your trusty jetpack. Reunite the crew, making sure not to run out of oxygen and leave them to drift in the void. Beware of molten planets, speeding comets, and deadly gravity wells. And when everyone in the sector is reunited, make your way to the sun.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178302.description:
Centerville is a relatively light board game for 2-4 players. Centerville abstractly models the growth and management of a small city — perhaps not unlike the one you're in right now.

Players act as entrepreneurs, tycoons, politicians, and other local movers and shakers working to develop a modern urban area. Fortunes will be made and fame will rise. As time goes by, personal milestones will enrich the players even further.

Throughout the game, players will roll six dice, keeping some and rerolling others, then implementing the various die faces on the game board. This will result in political offices being gained and lost, new vocations learned, new land acquired, or new buildings constructed. The end result is a vibrant community revered near and wide — but only the player who has best balanced their wealth and prestige will emerge the final victor.

Playing time is 15-20 minutes per player.
178302.name: Welcome to Centerville

178303.name: Tiltagon
178303.description:
Tilt.Fall.Repeat.

Tiltagon is a hard arcade game where you tilt and fall.

Many times.

Sometimes you also explode.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178306.name: Game Night In A Can
178306.description:
GNIAC is a party game that includes Creative Contests, Team Challenges, and Games of Skill. There are 30 games inside the can, and a spinner underneath the lid.

To play, you spread the cards out, grab some pens and paper, and hit the spinner to find your first host. That person chooses a card, reads the game out loud, then hosts that game. If it's a creative game, that host is also the judge. Play 6-8 games in a night, and whoever has the most points is the winner.

Games include composing new national anthems for different countries, banking paper balls off your teammate's forehead into the can, launching paper airplanes, creating new animals for Noah's Ark 2.0, presenting new business ideas, and a lot more.

178309.name: Dagon (Issue 2 - Feb 1984)
178309.description: Includes editorial, comic (The Cats of Ulthar), reviews, and the second part of the module No Room at Innsmouth.

178310.name: Dagon (Issue 3 - Aug 1984)
rpgissuearticle: A Tribute to Clark Ashton Smith
178310.description: Includes editorial, comic, reviews, article, and tribute to Clark Ashton Smith.

178311.name: Dagon (Issue 4 - Oct 1984)
178311.description: Editorial, new character class, article, comic, new monster, fiction.

178313.name: Dagon (Issue 6 - Mar 1985)
178313.description: Editorial, new NPC class, article, reviews, new magic items, new monster

178314.description: Star Trek: Attack Wing — Robinson Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 21 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
178314.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Robinson Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

178315.description: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Bajoran Lightship Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 21 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
178315.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Denorios Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

178316.description: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Dreadnought Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 21 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
178316.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Dreadnought Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

178317.name: Takoashi University: Cephology Club
178317.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

178318.name: Takoashi University: Kibachan
178318.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

178319.name: Takoashi University: Tough Cookie Club
178319.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

178320.name: Takoashi University: Study Hall
178320.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

178321.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 14 - May 2007)
rpgissuearticle: Archetypus: Priester des roten Planeten aus Sidor Corabis
Myranische Reit-, Zug und Lasttiere II
178321.description:
3 Vorwort - uncredited
4 – Myranische Reit-, Zug und Lasttiere II – Andere Huftiere und Humanoide Kai König

28 – Geisterkrieger Kai König
37 - Myranor extrem I : Der Muskelkater Christian Saßenscheidt
38 Impressum

178322.name: Night falls in Palermo
178322.description:
It's a deduction game in which each player takes a secret role.
There is a big variation of roles with different abilities, but the essential ones are the murderers, their spy, the cup and the victims.

The game starts and the cup knows one murderer and the spy. Each day after discussion players vote to lynch one player, who is eliminated without making known his identity, and without participating for the rest of the game. After the day, during the night murderers show to the already eliminated players, who they are killing.

Game ends if all murderers are killed, or if the number of murderers is the same with all the 'good' players.

178323.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 15 - Aug 2007)
rpgissuearticle: Myranische Reit-, Zug und Lasttiere III
Myranor Extrem II – Bello waw Alantinos
178323.description:
3 Vorwort - Horstmann
4 – Myranische Reit-, Zug und Lasttiere III – Chimären, Echsen und andere Kai König
10 – Myranisches Aventurien I – Die Faune Christian Saßenscheidt
12 Am GirRaos Kochecke – valantische Knoblauchcreme und Varkenkäsetaschen Corinna Kersten
13 – Brassachs Hirten – Die Minotauren Myranors René Littek
15 – Die Glut der Blätter – Das Herbstfest der Satyare Annekatrin Hepp, Christian Saßenscheidt
19 – Die Geweihten des HC mit Texten und Ideen oder aufbauend auf solchen von Peter Horstmann, Kai König, René Littek, Olaf Michel, Christian Saßenscheidt, Michael Spies und Michael Wuttke
27 – Myranor Extrem II – Bello waw Alantinos Christian Saßenscheidt
29 Impressum

178324.name: Perilous Deeps
178324.description:
From publisher blurb:

How do you write a dungeon for Dungeon World? In this 72-page, fully-illustrated collection you will find six different approaches, inspired in part by the dungeon creation guidelines in The Perilous Wilds.

These "deeps" include:

A citadel of glass, shimmering above the dunes in "Uncertain Reflections," by Joe Banner
The burial place of a great elven hero in "Brightrock Barrow," by Jeremy Strandberg
The earthly fane of unearthly parasites, in "Those Who Make Vows," by Johnstone Metzger
The folly of a prideful Cyclopean sorcerer, in "The Pit of Vanzwink," by Jason Lutes
A house of many doors that open into worlds beyond, in "Eesha’s Gulf," by Dungeon World co-author Adam Koebel
A subterranean pyramid, riddled with unpseakable horrors in "Raising Hell Under the Holy Mountain," by Claytonian




Whether you're kicking off a new Dungeon World campaign or need to flesh out an adventure in a pinch, you'll find what you're looking for in the Perilous Deeps!

178325.name: Luna:   Shattered Hearts:  Episode One
178325.description:
User Summary

You awake at the bottom of a cliff deep inside a planet and are guided back by a friendly female character. The game play is very platform-like with an inventory of various weapons and potions, but the theme of the game is relationships, love, and trust. As a result, there is partial nudity and it is rated M for Mature.

178327.description:
Shadows in the Weald introduces the Heroes & Hirelings system of fantasy skirmish combat games. Each player controls a Party comprised of two kinds of Characters: Heroes and, you guessed it, Hirelings. Heroes are powerful, named Characters with special abilities. Hirelings are anonymous mooks who give adjacent Characters the benefits (and detriments) of Buffs.

Shadows in the Weald is a fast-paced crazy-action square-and-counter extravaganza with bells on. The game comes with eight different Heroes, eight different types of Hirelings, several Magic Items, and five scenarios. It debuts in the fifth issue of Yaah! magazine.
178327.name: Shadows in the Weald

178328.name: Earn to Die 2: Exodus
178328.description:
Publisher's Blurb:
The city has been overrun! Unlock and upgrade vehicles and drive your way through zombie hordes in order to escape.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178329.name: Dungeon Dare / Classroom Chaos
178329.description:
User Summary:

Dungeon Dare and Classroom Chaos were released as a single package with one game on each side of a single cassette.

Dungeon Dare is an arcade game with two alternating types of level, a side-on platform screen and a top-down maze screen.

Classroom Chaos is a text-based adventure.

From the Inlay:

Dungeon Dare - Written by Richard Wright

Trapped in a dungeon you are in grave danger. Your energy is sapped if you touch a monster but energy pills may revitalise you. Will you survive long enough to collect the forty eight keys you need to escape?

Classroom Chaos - Written by Dave Watson

Someone broke into your school last night and stole the famous challenge gold cup. The bad news is that the headmaster thinks that you did it. You have to find the person who is responsible before the headmaster finds you!

178330.name: Enascentia: Dietro lo Schermo
178330.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ogni opera si svolge su di un palcoscenico, ma spesso è ciò che accade dietro le quinte a deciderne le sorti. Dietro lo Schermo vi accompagna a scoprire i retroscena di Enascentia, la sua storia, i suoi misteri. Il passato non è più un segreto, il futuro è nelle vostre mani.

Questo tomo, pensato per i Game Master, include:

Le origini di Enascentia
L'elenco di tutte le Tribù Perdute
La storia delle Razze Regie, dall'ultima Sovversione al 996 P.G.
Più di 150 personaggi pre-generati pronti all'uso
20 tracce per creare le vostre avventure
Un'entusiasmante Trama Portante che cambierà il destino di Enascentia





Translation Courtesy of Google:

Each work takes place on a stage, but it is often what happens behind the scenes to decide the fate. Behind the screen takes you to discover the ins and outs of Enascentia, its history, its mysteries. The past is no longer a secret, the future is in your hands.

This tome, designed for the Game Master, includes:

The origins of Enascentia
The list of all the Lost Tribes
The history of the Races Regie, since Subversion to 996 PG
More than 150 pre-generated characters ready
20 tracks to create your own adventures
An exciting plot that will change the fate of Carrier Enascentia

178331.name: Fomorians and Faith
178331.description:
From publisher blurb:

A POCKET SETTING FOR YOUR OLD SCHOOL FANTASY GAME!

When the Fomorians created the pocket dimension of ATHCONNIT, they accidentally produced a PLANAR NEXUS where the only way to escape is to MURDER A FOMORIAN! If that weren't bad enough for the Fomorians, enough people decided to stay that a religious Cold War between Christianity and Islam dominates the island!

Includes a NEW PLAYABLE RACE, the hive-minded Chorals, and TWO new monsters: The dread ELFCURSED and of course the Fomorians of Athconnit themselves!

And this only scratches the surface of this exiting new POCKET SETTING... This supplement is just enough to get you started, with no huge tome of canon to memorize!

IVANHOE UNBOUND is PROUD to present this tiny but POTENT NEW SETTING for SWORDS AND WIZARDRY WHITEBOX or ANY OTHER OLD SCHOOL GAME based on the 1974 three booklet version of the WORLD-FAMOUS RPG whose name rhymes with "TRUNCHEONS AND FLAGONS!"

178332.name: Wedding Daze
178332.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a future hero, your master has given you one last task to complete before releasing you from your training - delivering a message. Knowing that you are about to start your career on your own is exciting and this task should be a simple one. A two day trip to congratulate Lord Siklos on the wedding of his daughter and you will control your own destiny. Little do you realize that something has gone terribly wrong at the ceremony!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a solo/low level adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

178333.name: Rise of the Ilu
178333.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Gods Have Returned...

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface it is no different than the world you and I live in. Most people go on about their lives never realizing the terrors that walk among them.
Despite humanity’s vast ignorance, the horrors are there. Angels and demons make war in the shadows. Hellspawn serve their demonic masters. Ancient gods, once imprisoned in a dark realm called Oblitus, now walk the Earth, seeking followers to help regain their former glory.

There's a war in the shadows....but for how much longer?

Rise of the Ilu

Rise of the Ilu is a 192-page supplement for the Contagion Second Edition Role-Playing Game published by Aegis Studios. This full-color supplement includes rules for playing members of the Ilu race, or as humans call them: gods. Whether a Gamemaster wishes to introduce the Ilu as a shadowy threat in the background, or run a campaign in which players assume the roles of these ancient deities, Rise of the Ilu includes everything you need to take your Contagion Second Edition campaign to a celestial level!

Rise of the Ilu includes:

Two new playable races: The godly Ilu and their demi-god children, the Ikkibu
13 new Feats
51 new Spells with effects up to Magnitude 9
New systems including means to ascend to godhood, methods for celestials to become mortal and the secrets of truly killing celestials.
Details on the Factions of the Ilu
9 new Realms for use in your Contagion Second Edition campaign, including the first look at the secrets of Heaven.
30 pregenerated Ilu characters, ready for use in your campaign.
Detailed information on the metaplot of Contagion Second Edition.
Gamemaster tips for running celestial campaigns
10 player handouts including various prophecies of things to come in the world of Contagion Second Edition.
New creatures, including Dinosaurs and Heavenspawn

178334.name: Psytron
178334.description:
From the inlay:

Less than human, far more than mere computer.

The Psytron controls the massive Betula 5 Installation. When the attack comes, it will cope with defensive demands which would leave a human brain unhinged, computer circuits scrambled.

Damage in any sector of the base must be assessed and its effect on the fabric of the installation calculated immediately.

Human lives will be expended as necessary but if the Psytron ever goes down...

User Summary:

Psytron is an unusual shooter in many ways, especially for the mid-1980s.

Each level has the player taking on additional responsibilities. The first few levels simply have you blasting enemies on the ground and in the air, later levels have the player freezing time to deal with damage control. The final levels involve you communicating with ships in orbit to bring down supplies you need to keep the base operational. The aim of the last level is to survive for a full hour.

To progress to the next level, the game assesses not just your one-off performance, but the average of your last five attempts at each level. These are saved to tape as your 'Service Record'.

At the end of the game a score is displayed based 60% on how long you kept the base intact and 40% on the average scores on the previous levels stored in the Service Record.

The code could be submitted to Beyond Software to win a Sinclair Q.L.. This would be won either by the first person to complete the game (surviving an hour on the last level) or whoever gained the best score by 30 November 1984.

178335.description:
Biergarten is designed to be a quick game for a relaxing afternoon with friends, and features 64 individually designed cards with Alpine-inspired architecture and decor.

Biergarten is essentially a tile placement game, and players compete as up-and-coming restaurant owners expanding their outdoor patios, or biergartens. Each card features either one or two colors, as well as a wall segment on one, two, or three sides of the card. Players earn points for each color match that they make, and having a match between each of the four colors earns a bonus of three points. Watch out for walls -- they block the flow of the garden, and color matches can't be made through a wall. However, if players can entirely enclose their biergarten within a continuous wall, they earn a six point bonus.

The first player to fifteen points triggers the victory round, with each player thereafter getting one additional turn to top the winning point value.
178335.name: Biergarten

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork & Presentation Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
178336.description:
The World's Fair of 1893 in Chicago was a spectacular international exhibition that showcased many great achievements in science, technology, culture, and entertainment. Acting as organizers of the fair, players work diligently to increase their influence throughout the fair and obtain the grand exhibits that will be put on display. The organizer who has earned the best reputation when the fair begins will emerge the victor.

On each turn of World's Fair 1893, the active player sends a supporter to one of the five areas and gather all of the cards by it. New cards are then added to some of the areas, and the next player takes a turn.

The five areas represent sections of exhibits, like Fine Arts and Electricity. Some cards represent exhibit proposals in one of those five areas, others represent influential people who give you bonus supporters, and other cards represent tickets for attractions and concessions along the Midway.

The game consists of three scoring rounds, each triggered when players collectively gather a certain number of Midway tickets. Players gain reputation points for leading in number of supporters in an area and for gathering the most tickets in each round. The leaders in an area also receive approval for exhibit proposals they have gathered that match the area. Players gain reputation points at the end of the game based on the breadth and diversity of their approved exhibits.
178336.name: World's Fair 1893
boardgameaccessory: World's Fair 1893: J. Alex Kevern Promo Card
boardgamepodcastepisode: 09 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Types of Play
18. Devon Dice Podcast - Warring colons

Episode 54- GenCon 2015 and La Granja (Plus a CONTEST!)

Perfect Information Podcast Episode 32 - The very best games of 2016
Publisher Interview - Randy Hoyt
Rick & Morty Star in a Board Game

Vox Republica 098: BFIG, The Big Friendly Indie Giant
Vox Republica 119: The Evolution Of A Pandemic
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 41!!! Avalanche at Yeti Mountain Preview, NY 1901 Review

What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 44!!! The EPIC Week!!!

What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 48!!! Ft Patrick Hillier, Eric Booth, AnnaBeth and Kerensa
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 49!! Featuring Chris and Joe from Cardboard Architects, Eric Booth, AnnaBeth and Kerensa
What Did You Play this Week Podcast Thing Week 79
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 85!
World’s Fair 1893 Review with the Game Boy Geek

178337.name: Corrotto
178337.description:
Corrotto is a crime/politics themed market game played with a standard deck of cards. Separate the deck into 3 decks, the draw deck A/2/3/4, the Market Deck 5/6/7/8/9 and the board set up 10/Jokers/J/Q/K. Set up all KQJ10s in four rows of same suits placing Jokers on the tens and randomly draw four face up cards from the market deck below the tens. KQs are the Royal Council and the Jacks separate the council from the marketplace. The draw deck is where you legally earn money by drawing cards, the market deck gets drawn into the marketplace when cards are reserved or purchased. Purchase cards with cards of the same color.

When cards are discarded or spent they go face up into the appropriate decks discard section where market cards become the black market and draw cards become heists. To do illegal actions such as purchasing from the Black Market or perform a heist you must bribe a face card by placing a card higher than previous card of the same suit on the card taking lower bribe into your hand. Anyone can bribe a Jack but you must pay off a Royal for there loyalty. Pay off Queens first which cost 25 Of its suit minus the Jack bribe, same for king but also minus the Queen bribe, place a player marker on Royal. Royal bribes are always scored as end points but the game ends and scores differently in ways of play.

There are 3 different variants of Corrotto: Ladies First, Hot Potato and Rat Race.

178338.name: Random Heroes 3
178338.description:
Alien scum are invading earth one last time! A group of unlikely heroes are set out to save the world once and for all! From the creators of League of Evil and Devious Dungeon comes Ravenous Games’ newest title: Random Heroes 3!

Source: The Publisher Website.

178339.name: Glorkian Warrior: The Trials of Glork
178339.description:
Glorkian Warrior: The Trials of Glork is a collaboration between acclaimed comic book artist James Kochalka and indie game studio Pixeljam. It’s a unique hybrid of Galaga-style shoot ‘em up, simple platforming action and Saturday morning cartoon. Help Glorkian Warrior defend his asteroid against an endless onslaught of alien invaders, and be prepared for somewhat unexpected results…

Source: The Game Website.

178340.name: The Orc in the Well
178340.description:
User Summary

The Orc in the Well is a roleplaying poem, which is played in 15 minutes. It can be played with two or more players. In the game, the players collaboratively tell a story about an orc who is in a well.

The game was published as a bonus game at the back of The Society of Dreamers. The designer of the game has also posted the (very short) rules to his blog (Norwegian Style).

178341.name: RAD Boarding
178341.description:
RAD Boarding is an apocalyptic snowboarding game jam-packed with 90′s flair! Perform gnarly tricks and fight crazy boss battles as you race against the end of the world. With epic visuals and tons of items to collect, RAD Boarding lets you ride out the Apocalypse in style!

Source: The Publisher Website.

178342.name: Schweizer Reise
178342.description: Players secretly get 8 cards of destinations. On a map of Switzerland, they move their pawn according to a special dice showing 3 different dots and a question mark. If they roll a dot, they are entitled to move to the next space showing the same dot. Question mark means draw a card and follow the instructions. If you reach a space requested by one of your destination cards, you receive the mentioned number of adventure points. The player who visited first all 8 destinations receives another 5 points. Player with the most points wins.

178343.description: In Creature Clash! Card Game, you combine cards to create crazy new creatures out of real-life animals! You'll add the front of one, the middle of another, and the rear of a third. Add up the points for the newly formed creature and then stage attacks against the creatures in other players' hands. The highest score wins! Creature Clash Card Game is fun for all ages and helps you make creatures such as the Hippobaer, Gilanabat, and the Pirandillo!
178343.name: Creature Clash! Card Game

178344.name: The Fall Guy
178344.description:
User Summary

The Fall Guy is a game based on the 80s TV show starring Lee Majors.

In the game, you play a stunt man working on a movie. The movie has a limited budget which is constantly counting down. So the player must perform a number of stunts within a set time-limit. You also have a limited number of 'Takes' (Lives).

The stunts all involve jumping across various vehicles. The first level is jumping from a bridge onto a moving train, then running along the train and jumping from carriage to carriage, while avoiding an annoying bird. Fifteen jumps gives the director enough footage to move on to the next scene.

178345.name: Franky Expansion pack No. 1
178345.description:
Franky Expansion pack No. 1
2 game expansions for Franky Reloaded, contains the expansions Red Eyes & Tally List.

The laboratory of Franky is opened.
These expansion dice bring a new depth and even more fun for Franky Reloaded!
Every single expansion die is rolled as usual together with all other dice at the beginning of the player’s regular dice turn and can be laid aside according to the existing rules.
The new features of the expansions have great influence on the game behavior of all players!

German description:
Franky Erweiterungspack No. 1
2 Spielerweiterungen für Franky Reloaded, enthält die Erweiterungen Red Eyes & Tally List.

Das Labor von Franky ist eröffnet.
Diese Erweiterungswürfel bringen eine neue Spieltiefe und noch mehr Spielspaß für Franky Reloaded!
Jeder einzelne Erweiterungswürfel wird am Anfang des regulären Würfeldurchgangs ganz normal mit den anderen Würfeln mitgewürfelt und kann dann nach den bestehenden Regeln rausgelegt werden ..
Die neuen Funktionen der Erweiterungen haben großen Einfluss auf das Spielverhalten aller Spieler!

178346.name: Franky Expansion pack No. 2
178346.description:
Franky Expansion pack No. 2
2 game expansions for Franky Reloaded, contains the expansions Sexy Six & Thunder Storm.

The laboratory of Franky is entering the secound round.
These expansion dice bring a new depth and even more fun for Franky Reloaded!
Every single expansion die is rolled as usual together with all other dice at the beginning of the player’s regular dice turn and can be laid aside according to the existing rules.
The new features of the expansions have great influence on the game behavior of all players!

German description:
Franky Erweiterungspack No. 2
2 Spielerweiterungen für Franky Reloaded, enthält die Erweiterungen Sexy Six & Thunder Storm.

Das Labor von Franky geht in die zweite Runde.
Diese Erweiterungswürfel bringen eine neue Spieltiefe und noch mehr Spielspaß für Franky Reloaded!
Jeder einzelne Erweiterungswürfel wird am Anfang des regulären Würfeldurchgangs ganz normal mit den anderen Würfeln mitgewürfelt und kann dann nach den bestehenden Regeln rausgelegt werden ..
Die neuen Funktionen der Erweiterungen haben großen Einfluss auf das Spielverhalten aller Spieler!

178347.name: Franky Expansion pack No. 3
178347.description:
Franky Expansion pack No. 3
2 game expansions for Franky Reloaded, contains the expansions Crazy Nine & Dead End.

The laboratory of Franky is entering the third round.
These expansion dice bring a new depth and even more fun for Franky Reloaded!
Every single expansion die is rolled as usual together with all other dice at the beginning of the player’s regular dice turn and can be laid aside according to the existing rules.
The new features of the expansions have great influence on the game behavior of all players!

German description:
Franky Erweiterungspack No. 3
2 Spielerweiterungen für Franky Reloaded, enthält die Erweiterungen Crazy Nine & Dead End.

Das Labor von Franky geht in die dritte Runde.
Diese Erweiterungswürfel bringen eine neue Spieltiefe und noch mehr Spielspaß für Franky Reloaded!
Jeder einzelne Erweiterungswürfel wird am Anfang des regulären Würfeldurchgangs ganz normal mit den anderen Würfeln mitgewürfelt und kann dann nach den bestehenden Regeln rausgelegt werden ..
Die neuen Funktionen der Erweiterungen haben großen Einfluss auf das Spielverhalten aller Spieler!

178348.name: Activity Champion
178348.description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this edition, players do not play in teams anymore, but try to get as many points for only themselves. The cards show 4 different words, as well as the way you need to explain them (verbally, pantomimic, by drawing). The rules are slightly changed so that it works without teams. Points are given to the player who guesses right and the player who acted, described or drew the words.

178349.name: Empires at Sea
178349.description:
Launch your fleet, capture ports, and wage war in the absolutely epic board game for 2-5 players. In Empires at Sea, you play as one of five nations, and work to amass the largest empire at the end of 15 rounds of play.

A Quick Overview of the Game

Each Round opens with a History Card, which hurts or helps one nation or another based on the actual impact of the actual historical event. A Weather Card is played, limiting or improving movement for all players for the Round (e.g., ships can only move North and East). Next, all players gain resources, based on the Ports they own, plus any Resource Cards played during the game.

Each player then takes a turn, first by playing a Captain's Card (used to launch a ship, advance your military, strengthen a port, etc) and then by sailing their fleet to take command of new ports, trade, or attack their enemies. The combat system is based on a roll of the dice, plus modifiers for ship size, the weather gauge, military advancements, and Captain's Orders.

At the end of the round, all players may bribe the Pirate. The highest bidder gets to use this ship to attack their friends/enemies/loved-ones.

At the end of the game, you tally up your Empire score based on the ships you sink, the ships you command, the ports you own, and the gold and resources you've collected. The biggest Empire wins.

178350.name: Pretense: The Geek Promo
178350.description: The Geek is a BoardGameGeek inspired Pretense role card, that's only available in the BGG Store. The card states "If another player visits BoardGameGeek.com, you may take their role card." Players need to sneakily convince another player that they need to look up a rule clarification, game rating, or anything else BGG related in order to steal their role and gain a point.

178351.name: Sjansen
178351.description:
"Sjansen" is a Dutch word for flirting. It's a tongue in cheek game about flirting.

From the publisher's website:
In the bar, at courtside or in class rooms: flirting is possible everywhere. Nevertheless one is better at it than the other. Fortunately a game exists that teaches you flirting in three simple lessons. Decide how far you will go and with whom.

It's a matter of luck, an enormous challenge, but above all it's a tactical game. Newbies need practise, others are naturals. Anyway every single student needs to do it often. Everyone gets the same lessons but not everyone will learn as fast. Mixed signals, it's all there. Take your chance and maybe you will find Mr. or Mrs. Right this way!

178352.name: Sentry Knight
178352.description:
User Summary

Action-based tower defense including a plethora of spells, talents, upgrades, enemies and bosses!

178353.name: Earn to Die 2012
178353.description:
Smash through hordes of zombies as you drive your way through a zombie apocalypse, unlocking and upgrading vehicles along the way.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178354.name: Memoria Myrana (Issue 16 - Nov 2007)
178354.description:
3 - Vorwort - Horstmann
4 – Wasserstraßen Myranors Dennis Rüter
16 – Priester der Sterne II Florian Wassermann
24 - Am GirRaos Kochecke – Trivina Pida - Corinna Kersten, Peter Horstmann
25 - Doszresch Ende Peter Horstmann
26 – Versunkene Mächte René Littek
30 – Archetypus: Der nequanische Unterseekrieger Florian Wassermann
33 - Myranisches Aventurien II – Die Amaunir der Charyptik - Christian Saßenscheidt
34 - Myranor Extrem III - Christian Saßenscheidt
35 - Impressum

178355.name: Mugsy
178355.description:
From the inlay:

Mugsy is a brand new and exciting gangster game for the 48K Spectrum - the first interactive video comic strip!.

You are Mugsy, the Godfather to a gang of hoodlums and your aim is to be the toughest and most powerful gang leader in the city.

Your tasks involve managing the gang, making lots of money, organizing the protection rackets, buying weapons and ammunition but beware, your reign as the Big Boss is rather delicate. If you are too successful a contract will be put out by other gangs to get rid of you!

If a contract is put out, a vicious shoot-out may occur and at this stage a full arcade game is incorporated into the program.

178356.name: Buzz Killem
178356.description:
Buzz Killem is the story of a retired War Veteran called back into action after an Alien welcoming party greets Earth. And he is the father of famed action star Bill Killem.
Embark on missions of explosive proportions as you save America for the wrath of alien invaders! Visit usually peaceful and pleasant tourist spots like the Statue of Liberty and Grand Central Station and defend them from utter obliteration!

Source: The Publisher Website.

178357.name: Kong
178357.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Donkey Kong.




From the inlay:

Rescue the girl from the clutches of Kong. Full 4 screen game with solid machine code featuring rolling barrels, fire, flying dumbells and moving lifts. Only on the 4th screen can the beast be defeated and brought crashing down!

User Summary

Kong was written by Paul Owens and is a clone of the classic Donkey Kong arcade game. The main difference on the first screen is that there are only five gantries rather than six in the original. Kong therefore ends up on the opposite side of the screen.

Nintendo apparently did not hold a grudge about the release of this game - Ocean published an officially licensed version of Donkey Kong in 1986.

178358.name: Pumped BMX 2
178358.description:
Following the 2012 cult hit, Pumped BMX is back and packed full of more wild levels, more wild tricks, and over 500 challenges and achievements. Oh, and it’s 3D too!

Ride your way through increasingly challenging levels while pulling off crazy trick combinations. 16 authentic BMX tricks can be combined with flips, spins, grinds and manuals for almost unlimited creativity. Includes a totally redesigned tutorial system so in just a few minutes anyone can be shredding like a pro.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178359.name: Bitcoin Billionaire
178359.description:
Bitcoin Billionaire is an idle clicker that’s all about raking in bitcoins and building up a massive fortune! You start with almost nothing: a run-down office, a rickety old desk, a crummy computer. By tapping the screen you can mine virtual bitcoins and slowly increase your wealth. Spend digital dough to upgrade that awful furniture into swanky things like entertainment centers and priceless works of art. If you’re smart (which, you are!), you’ll spend some of that money on investments to help you earn while you’re away. And don’t worry, investments aren’t as boring as in real life. How could robot butlers, virtual reality and holographic dating be anything but awesome?

Source: The Publisher Website.

178360.name: Mmm Fingers
178360.description:
Mmm Fingers is a fun, single touch high score game oozing with charm from the creators of Small Fry and Flappy Golf. Touch and hold the screen as long as you can. Don’t lift your finger or hit anything with teeth or else CHOMP, it is game over. Compete against your friends using in game leaderboards to see who can survive the longest.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178361.description:
Waka Tanka is a very light bluffing card game in the Bullshit family. Players are Native American shamans who want to impress the tribe by conjuring various animal spirits and having long discussions with them. The problem is that the shaman doesn't always remember the right incantation and somewhat calls the wrong spirit — hoping no one will notice.

Each player in turn plays an incantation card face down in front of an animal totem. Other players can call the bluff if they think it's not the right animal. A player can also try a full ceremony if he thinks enough incantations have been made to a given animal spirit. A player wins by getting rid of all their incantation cards or fulfilling two ceremonies.
178361.name: Waka Tanka
boardgamepodcastepisode: Waka Tanka Review with the Game Boy Geek

178362.name: Mont a Mots Gorgotte
178362.description:
Translated from the back of the box:

Find the key hidden inside the caverns and free the knights from the claws of the dragon Gorgotte.

Answering questions will help you discover the hidden caches in the caves.

Use your weapons to combat the monsters and avoid being captured by the Dragon Gorgotte.

Find the keys and free your companion knights and win the game.

Mont a Mots Gorgotte was created with a simple idea in mind: Help young children in the first cycle of education to learn French in an original and playful way. Based on tested tools and expert teachers the family game Mont a Mots is designed to help your children. Offer your child Mont a Mots, a most entertaining tool to assist in the development of your child.

Basically you are a knight battling monsters while traveling around the game board. Caves along the way contain power ups (weapons and healing items) to assist you in your battles. However to obtain them, you must answer questions on cards. These questions are designed to improve your ability to speak and understand French.

The game comes with the box, instructions, game board, 275 questions, 5 cardboard knights, 5 pawn holders, 39 cardboard tokens and one d6.

178363.name: Kong Strikes Back
178363.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Mr. Do!'s Wild Ride.




From the inlay:

All the fun of the fair and the fury of Kong as he strikes back with Roller Coasters, Waltzers, Swinging Gyms and Hobbey Horses in this action packed extravaganza.

Guide your man up the fairground track to rescue the damsel in distress who is waiting for you at the top of the track and is guarded by the mighty Kong. You must avoid the Roller Coaster cars or you will be knocked off the track and lose a life. You must also avoid other obstacles such as pies and springs. You may stop the cars by bombing them. If your bonus time reaches zero you lose a life.

User Summary

This is the second in Ocean's Kong series. However rather than a clone of the Donkey Kong series, this game is instead a clone of the Universal arcade game Mr Do!'s Wild Ride. Strangely, only the Amstrad version shows Kong sitting towards the top of the track. On the Spectrum and Commodore versions, Kong only makes brief appearances in-game to place new roller coaster cars on the track.

178364.name: Uno Avengers
178364.description:
Unite with Earth's Mightiest heroes in this Avengers edition of Uno Game!

Fight the foes no single hero could withstand with the special Avengers Assemble card!

And remember to yell "Uno!" before you play your last card and the battle is won!

Contents: 112 cards, instructions. includes 4 special Avengers Assemble cards with a special rule:

Whenever evil dares to show its face, the Avengers assemble to defeat it! When another player plays a Draw 2 or a Draw 4 card on you, you may use this card to block it! This card is also a wild card, so you choose the color that resumes play.

178365.name: Death Star Interceptor
178365.description:
From the inlay:

Excerpt from the Encyclopaedia Galactica A.D. 4020:

...Aix the most valuable material in the galaxy. Precious because of its life prolonging radiations in its processed state. Contact with Raw Aix however caused severe ageing and deformation of all living tissue. The Galactic Empire dominated by the evil Ardands used humanoids to mine Aix from over 2000 mines ... Slaves were "worthless" a humanoid miner had a life expectancy of 5 days by which time is body was no longer useful for any other purpose.

To supply its Aix mines with sufficient slaves The Empire imposed the "Quota-Law" ... All humanoid inhabited planets had to produce slaves for the mines of face termination. This law served a two fold purpose for The Empire, its Aix mines were supplied with all the slaves required and the subject world's population was kept depleted of its youth and hence any fires of rebellion. Failure to comply with the "Quota-Law" resulted in an Empire Deathstar being despatched to obliterate the defiant world, with its weaponry, or by pushing it into its own sun with a tractor beam.

The year is 4021. The Earth has refused to give up any more of its people to be slaughtered in The Empire's Aix mines! The Galactic Empire's Deathstar approached Earth's defences, prepare to meet its onslaught. However Earth's Defence Council knows no planet's defences can ever hope to defeat a Deathstar. Earth has only one hope.

The Deathstar is known to have one weakness, the central reactor providing its power located deep within its defences of forcefields, laser turrets and fighter craft. If a single Earth fighter can penetrate its defences and score a direct it on the reactor's exhaust port the reactor will go nova taking the entire Deathstar with it!

User Summary

Death Star Interceptor is heavily influenced by the Atari vector graphics Star Wars arcade machine, but played from a third person perspective. The Star Wars influences in the Spectrum version extend to the name and design of the "Deathstar", the X-Wing style player sprite, the TIE-Fighter style ships the player must shoot down in space and even an officially licensed version of John Williams' famous theme tune! The C64 version uses different designs for the player and enemies.

The gameplay is reminiscent of the arcade game with a few minor differences. The first level, not in the arcade game, has your ship taking off (to a synthesised female voice urging you to "Prepare to Launch!"). The aim is to fly your ship accurately into a "Stargate" to launch into space. The second level is reminiscent of the space stage on the original arcade machine where waves of TIE Fighters assault your ship, but plays more like a Galaxians-style shooter. The enemy ships must be shot or avoided while the Deathstar grows ominously in the top left of the screen. There is no equivalent of the Death Star surface run from the arcade machine. The third stage goes straight to the Trench Run, where the player must avoid obstacles, shoot or avoid weapon emplacements and ultimately shoot at the Exhaust Port to destroy the Deathstar.

The player has three lives, but also 5 shields for each life, so can be hit quite a lot of times.

178367.name: Majestic Nights
178367.description:
User Summary

You are a wetwork detective caught up in a world confused between crime and government conspiracy. Following through chapters, you progress by sleath and acummulating information and items to make it out alive.
