The game starts with a free chapter and then proceeds to a DLC play system for ensuing chapters.

178368.name: Ozzy Versus The Universe Part I - Demons of Topaz
178368.description:
From the inlay:

Ozzy, lone and intrepid space traveller and keen exponent of the deadly Sonic Triang explores the seemingly endless depths of the dreaded asteroid, Topaz, searching for the seven jewels he needs to re-energise his ageing spacecraft. But can he survive a confrontation with the Demon Guardians - who slowly awaken to avenge the destruction of the Sacred Crystals!

User Summary

This was the first release from the Firebird Gold label. The game was written by schoolboy Andrew Bailey in just a couple of weeks. The boomerang weapon inspired the name of the main character "Ozzy". A sequel was planned but never released.

178369.name: Knight-mare Chess
178369.description: In Knight-mare Chess each player controls their troops with their knights and the shaman. Players should move their pieces and destroy their opponents with strategy and luck.

178370.name: Dagon (Issue 7 - May 1985)
178370.description: Editorial, articles, reviews, comic, letters, miniatures review, fiction.

178371.name: Dagon (Issue 8 - Jul 1985)
178371.description: Editorial, computerization, articles, reviews, fiction, letters.

178373.name: Dagon (Issue 10 - Nov 1985)
rpgissuearticle: A Checklist of H.P. Lovecraft's Fiction, Part 1
The Horror at Witches Hollow, Part 1
178373.description: Editorial, articles, fiction, Q&A, letters, reviews.

178374.name: Dagon (Issue 11 - Jan 1986)
rpgissuearticle: A Checklist of H.P. Lovecraft's Fiction, Part 2
Shoggoths Don't Kill People, Guns Do
Some Notes on the Eltdown Shards
The Horror at Witches Hollow, Part 2
178374.description: Editorial, articles, fiction, reviews, Q&A, reviews, letters.

178375.name: Dagon (Issue 12 - Apr 1986)
rpgissuearticle: The Horror at Witches Hollow, Part 3
Tiahuanaco - Great Archaeological Sites: The Truths
178375.description: Editorial, fiction, articles, Q&A, reviews, fiction, letters.

178377.name: Dagon (Issue 13 - Jun 1986)
rpgissuearticle: On Receiving a Small RPG Piece
Responses to "Guns Don't Kill People, Shoggoths Do!"
Sleep, Perchance to Dream - Dreaming in Call of Cthulhu
The H. P. Lovecraft Checklist of Fiction
The House of the Temple, Part 2
Unauthorized Alterations to "Alone in the Dark"
178377.description: Editorial, poem, articles, letters, interview, reviews, Q&A, fiction.

178378.name: Dagon (Issue 14 - Jun 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Great Zimbabwe Horrific Revelations from the Diary of Prof. Simon Davreau
Plagued by Dreams - Nightmares for Investigators
178378.description: Editorial, articles, Q&A, fiction, reviews, letters.

178380.name: Space-Pilot II
178380.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Time Pilot '84: Further Into Unknown World.




User Summary

Space-Pilot II is a clone of the arcade game Time Pilot '84, with a few differences. The original arcade game has ground targets as well as air targets, but these are missing from the C64 game. The C64 game does however have a multiplayer mode with up to 8 players on-screen at once.

Gameplay is similar to the original Time Pilot, with the player piloting a space ship over an 8-way scrolling background. Each level is set in a different time period. Surviving for a certain length of time jumps to a different time period, but in this version of the game there is little to differentiate the different time periods (unlike the original Time Pilot where each time period was clearly set in different historical wars - WWI, WWII, etc.).

178381.name: Richard Petty's Talladega
videogameversion: English European Commodore 64/128 Cassette (Americana re-release) edition
English European Commodore 64/128 Cassette (Top Ten re-release) edition
178381.description:
From the manual:

Take to the super speedway as you race against KING RICHARD PETTY and 18 top pro drivers. Test your skill in qualifying for a pole position and then let 'er rip in the real life 3-D main event where you lock horns with some of the "good ole boys!" Use strategy to plan your pit stops, draft leading cars to pick up time and save fuel, and be prepared for yellow caution flags. Make the right decisions, keep the pedal to the metal, have a little "racing luck" and you might beat Richard to the checkered flag. Remember, your opponents aren't just obstacles, they're "smart" drivers, each with his own strategy designed to beat you. After some experience you should learn to anticipate what many of the other drivers have planned, but watch out for Richard Petty... after 200 Grand National wins, he's not going to be easy and the KING doesn't like to lose!

178382.name: Off The Hook
videogamecompilation: Ozzy Versus The Universe Part I - Demons of Topaz
178382.description:
User Summary

Off The Hook was a charity compilation of ten games donated by various companies, organised by Christine Carty and published by Electric Dreams.

The inlay states that "All proceeds from this tape will go to the Prince's Trust for the rehabilitation of drug addicts, particularly Heroin Abuse." The compilation was released in the same year that a major anti-Heroin "Just Say No" campaign was under way in the UK, including a storyline and spin-off charity record from the popular Grange Hill children's TV programme.

The ZX Spectrum release consisted of the following games:

Pitfall II
Psytron
The Fall Guy
Ad Astra
Sam Stoat Safebreaker
Splat!
Mugsy
Kong Strikes Back
Chequered Flag
Blue Max

The Commodore 64 version consists of the following games:

Black Thunder
Death Star Interceptor
Ozzy Versus The Universe Part I - Demons of Topaz
The Fall Guy
Kong Strikes Back
Pitfall!
Pystron
Sheep In Space
Space-Pilot II
Richard Petty's Talladega

178383.name: Dagon (Issue 15 - Nov 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Mythos Names and How to Say Them
178383.description: Editorial, news, article, interview, comic, reviews, fiction, Q&A, letters.

178384.name: Dagon (Issue 16 - Jan 1987)
rpgissuearticle: The Sinister Secret of Shoggoth Street
178384.description: Editorial, news, fiction, poetry, articles, reviews, Q&A, letters.

178385.name: Dagon (Issue 17 - Apr 1987)
rpgissuearticle: H. P. Lovecraft as "Occultist" - An Exploration
Lovecraft, The Golden Dawn and Enochian Chess
The Prophets of Pandemonium - Arthur Machen and H.P. Lovecraft
Was there a Real Brown Jenkin?
178385.description: Editorial, news, articles, poems, Q&A, reviews, letters.

178386.name: Dagon (Issue 18/19 - Jul 1987)
rpgissuearticle: A Developing Series of Generic Forms
Lovecraft's Influence on T. E. D. Klein
T. E. D. Klein - Biographical Notes
T. E. D. Klein - Master of Ceremonies
T. E. D. Klein's Images of Terror
T. E. D. Klein: A Bibliography
The Ceremonies - First Printing of an Unpublished Chapter
The Ceremonies and Themes from Arthur Machen
The Events at Poroth Farm and the Literature of Horror
178386.description:
A "double edition" (issues 18 and 19), devoted to T. E. D. Klein's work.

Editorial, articles, fiction, bibliography, reviews, letters.

178387.name: Dagon (Issue 20 - Nov 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Fantasycon XII - My Appointment with Fear
The Journal of J. P. Drapeau
178387.description: Editorial, articles, news, crossword puzzle, fiction, reviews, letters.

178388.name: Dagon (Issue 21 - Mar 1988)
rpgissuearticle: In the Shadow of Another World
The Books of the Cthulhu Mythos

178389.name: Dagon (Issue 22/23 - Sep 1988)
rpgissuearticle: "The Lost Art of Twilight" - Two Aspects of the Vampire
Notes on the Writing of Horror
Nothing is What it Seems to Be
The Mystagogue, the Gnostic Quest, the Secret Book
178389.description:
Special "double" issue (issues 22 and 23) focusing on Thomas Ligotti.

Editorial, articles, bibliography, reviews, letters.

178391.name: Dagon (Issue 25 - Jun 1989)
rpgissuearticle: Excerpts from the Book of Jade

178393.name: Dagon (Issue 27 - Jun 1990)
rpgissuearticle: H. P. Lovecraft's Loathly Eldritch Band
Howl of Hastur - Fantasy Roleplaying in the Worlds of August Derleth
Scream for Jeeves, or, Cats, Rats and Bertie Wooster
The Dweller in the Pot, or, The Pasta Out of Space Eaters
178393.description:
Editorial, articles, reviews, letters. Humor special.

Includes art and articles by several fictitious persons, including Frank Chimesleep Short, H. P. G. Wodehouse, and Ruptured Often Hickman.

178394.name: Bandits
178394.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gostor is a Grumpy Old Schooler's Take On Rules. A series of product aimed at providing, simple yet robust rule additions to expand your game.

Gostor: Bandits presents a light, system-agnostic framework to create unique and interesting bandits groups. This book is usable for game systems set in any era, genre or location.

178395.name: The Adventures of the Atomic Rangers Episode 1: The Moon Ran Away With the Spoon
178395.description:
From publisher blurb:

When danger looms in the Solar system and the human race is threatened, only the Atomic Rangers have the power to defend them! As ancient secrets are discovered on the Moon, an old enemy stirs at the chance to wreak his revenge on earth and the Rangers! While the answers may lie on Venus, if Barn Zordo has any say, all the Ranger will find is their doom! Buckle up Rangers, for galactic adventure and interstellar mystery waits as you witness “The day the Moon ran away with the Spoon!”

From Episode 37 - The Moon Ran Away with the Spoon

Description: After months of the other Gagmen complaining that we have only been doing straight fantasy, we did this. This Pulp Space Adventure focuses on the world of the Atomic Rangers as they fly from planet to planet righting wrongs and thwarting evil. In this episode the rangers fly to the moon and then to the jungles of Venus. Expect many off color jokes as we take this adventure to Full Rocket Power!

178396.name: Cabal of Abstruse Enigmas
178396.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gruesome Gangs is an exciting Pathfinder Roleplaying Game® compatible product line providing the Game Master with a collection of non-player characters (NPCs) designed to work together from the perspective of backstory, game mechanics, or both. The groups are presented at different Challenge Ratings to increase their utility for multiple gamers. In addition, this allows player characters (PCs) to encounter one of these groups early in a campaign and then again after both teams have gained experience with minimal extra work for the Game Master!

If the entire team is unsuitable for inclusion in the campaign at the time, then NPC stat blocks can be used individually as needed. A mixed approach can also be interesting. By introducing a single foe into the campaign, this product gives a number of friends or allies that foe could call upon after running afoul of the PCs! This gives the Game Master a ready-made answer to who would the NPC go to for assistance, or even who would come to avenge his death at the hands of the PC party!

Using This Product

This product presents the overall history of the NPC team as well as the backstory for each individual member of the gang.

Each NPC has four stat blocks (CR 4, CR 9, CR 14, and CR 19) demonstrating his progression and growth over time. As a visual indicator, the color of the name bar designates which stat blocks from each NPC are of equivalent Challenge Rating along with the CR text.

Composition

Each gang is comprised of multiple members which can include a mixture of races, class levels, and templates. This section helps the Game Master compare different gangs’ capabilities and make-up at a glance without having to review each stat block.

Team Members

Bylarko Grigoryev – CE male human
Caderon of the Planes – LE male half-elf
Djoris Flamehearth – NE female halfling
Sisiorra Moonmeadow – LE female elf
Whisper – CN male sylph




Team Summary

An effective team of arcane killers, the Cabal of Abstruse Enigmas presents a dangerous challenge mixing summoned monsters, flashy spells, and close-quarters combat. The group is incredibly efficient but contain a number of stresses and secrets that keep them on the edge of internal collapse. They are masters of dungeon delves and provide an excellent rival or foil for exploring adventurers.

The team is assembled with an underlying vendetta against drow, which provides opportunity to crossover from foe to friend in certain situations. Their obsession with magical artifacts, spells, and forgotten lore leads them to seek the obscure all around the world. It is in these dark forgotten places where their murderous intent is revealed, leaving no survivors to tarnish their reputations in civilization.

178397.name: Samhain
178397.description:
Autumn Equinox: the beginning of the darkest and the coldest part of the year. To the Celts is the most feared. All the clans are preparing to celebrate Samhain, the big event where they invoke the favor of the gods asking for the strength to face the harsh winter and survive until the arrival of the new spring.

But survival is not all. Each clan, always competing against each other, also asks the gods to prevail over rivals and ensure the supremacy during the warm seasons.

From the ancient traditions of the mysterious Celtic rituals, this game will engage the player in a mystical and evocative atmosphere, where delicate magic's balances are manipulated in order to achieve goals and to prevail over opponents.The ancient Celtic tradition is the backdrop to a silent struggle for power that is consumed within that, more importantly, for survival.

Samhain is a game for 2-4 players that will test your ability: not only will you need to think about what is appropriate for your interests but also how your actions are going to change others’ choices: in the village clan members will do what you command, but you’ll trigger the same action for each opponent clan member who will be in your activated location. Are you ready to optimize your strategy to favor only your people? Will you know how to exploit opponent's actions for your goals?

Forget the days when you had to wait long times for your next turn! They are gone! In Samhain you'll always be alert and you will have to see what happens during other clans' turn: they may profit you or mark your downfall!

As someone said ... "Winter is coming". Better be prepared to face the coming winter!

178398.name: Stack 'Em 5
178398.description:
Stack 'Em 5 is a highly addictive, unique new board game that has aspects of several classics before it, such as chess, checkers, tic-tac-toe, Connect 4, Go, and even Pente, but on a whole new level, or should I say levels. Think of it as 3D connect 5 on gogo juice! And, unlike all its predecessors, and most strategy games of today, Stack'Em 5 allows for more than 2 players at a time. That being said, it is an incredibly strategic battle for 2 players, however as many as 7 can enjoy it, but with 8 or more we wont take responsibility for what might happen next. You and your family & friends will find a new meaning of competitiveness, making Monopoly Night look like a calm night! It's extremely simple to learn for even the youngest gamer, but will take years to master its strategies, making it challenging for the veteran player as well.

Strategy 101: Every single move counts in the which players try to achieve 5 in-a-row, ball by ball! The fundamental rules take less than a minute to learn, yet the game has the complexity to engage both beginners and experts alike - perfect for the entire family!

Stack 'Em 5 Rules!

Each player chooses a color and takes a set of balls. Players take turns stacking balls on the board, the first player starts by placing his/her first ball within the 9 center rods, after which point play is open to any of the 49 rods. Each and every ball is stacked strategically so that 5-in-a-row is accomplished vertically, horizontally, or diagonally just so long as it forms a straight line from point to point with NO turns. Easy Right! The rotation of play is counter-clockwise with a time limit of 30 seconds per turn, keeping you on your toes. The board itself spins completely around, either left or right on the center rod, giving the current player the ability to look at all the different angles. Only the current player may move the board, and he/she may do so as mush as they like, until the end of their turn. Once a ball is stacked, it cannot be removed or placed elsewhere, and the players turn is over. There are no restrictions on how balls of different colors are stacked. You may put a ball on any of the 49 rods that are open. Once 7 balls occupy a rod, that rod is full, giving the players a total of 343 possible positions on the board. The goal is to simply block your opponent from getting 5-in-a-row while strategically placing your balls to do just that. Be tactical. Obstruct your opponent(s) while expanding your own “territory”. The game ends when a player has been able to link 5-in-a-row in any way possible.

178399.name: Mythic Spell Compendium
178399.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Master Mythic Magic!

The Mythic Spell Compendium brings you over 2,000 mythic spells for your Pathfinder campaign! This book is an encyclopedic tome of magic, a comprehensive compilation of mythic versions for EVERY spell in the Pathfinder core rules and MORE! These spells are not just an exercise in bigger numbers (though you’ll find those here as well), but bring new and exciting dynamic and even cinematic options to your spellcasting character, many with augmentable variations to expand their power to an even grander scale.

There are earth-shaking magics here, alongside inventive and occasionally amusing uses for lower-level magics; everything from the humblest of cantrips to the mightiest of miracles, is covered between these pages. Coupled with the core mythic spells in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Mythic Adventures, every spellcaster, no matter how obscure their specialty, will find page after page of amazing options. If you are playing Pathfinder with the mythic rules, you need to grab this book.

HOWEVER, this book is an amazing resource for you even if you’re NOT using the mythic rules! The mythic rules are a terrific toolbox for making magic more mysterious and, even better, more interesting, in a standard Pathfinder campaign. From ancient cultures to secret cults, alien races to eldritch secrets, sacrificial sorcery to divine mysteries, all are sources from which the forgotten or forbidden lore of mythic magic could spring to new life in your Pathfinder campaign.

The Mythic Spell Compendium includes over 2000 mythic spells, including every spell from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, Pathfinder Roleplaying Advanced Player’s Guide, Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Race Guide, Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Combat, and Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Magic, as well as hundreds more spells from official Pathfinder products designed for the campaign setting and companion books. If they were not already published in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Mythic Adventures, you’ll find them here. All of them. It also includes hundreds more spells from some of the leading 3rd-party publishers for Pathfinder, including over 700 spells from Deep Magic by Kobold Press and over 100 spells from the Gothic Campaign Compendium and other products from Legendary Games.

178400.name: Mythic Hero's Handbook
178400.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Heroes Ready to Make History!

The Mythic Hero's Handbook brings you an incredible array of expansions for the mythic rules for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game! You'll find exciting and innovative ideas for existing rules alongside a wealth of all-new material from the authors that know mythic like nobody else. You'll find options galore to suit any character build and inspiration for new heroic directions to take on your path to immortality, whether your character is a holy hierophant or treacherous trickster, an indomitable champion or inventive genius, a steadfast guardian of others or a steely-eyed stranger ready to launch a roaring rampage of revenge!

These rules elements can be incorporated into a traditional Pathfinder Roleplaying Game campaign as well as one using the full mythic rules! While this book is an encyclopedic expansion to the mythic rules, many elements are easily slipped into a standard campaign in the form of lost lore, secret mysteries, and the training techniques of revered and ancient masters. The lost relics of an ancient civilization or the peculiar traditions of distant empires can all be modeled with the mythic rules. Even better, since the mythic rules function like a template overlaid upon a standard character, mythic power can easily be given through divine blessing, mysterious ritual, or the hand of destiny, and then withdrawn after the climactic crisis has passed.

The Mythic Hero's Handbook includes:

Over 120 new path abilities for the archmage, champion, guardian, hierophant, and trickster mythic paths and universal path abilities for every mythic character!
Four brand-new mythic paths - the genius, living saint, overmind, and the vengeful stranger - with over 150 path abilities exclusively for them!
Mythic class features for over 30 character classes for levels 1 to 20, including every core and base class in the core rules plus 11 more classes from Kobold Press and Rogue Genius Games like the battle scion, dragonrider, time thief, and white necromancer!
Over 1000 mythic feats, including mythic versions of every feat in the core rules, plus hundreds more from official companion products and the official campaign setting and more!
An entire chapter devoted to mythic psionics by the experts at Dreamscarred Press, including a new mythic path and 60 psionic path abilities, plus dozens of mythic psionic feats and over 100 mythic psionic powers!
Over 30 mythic magic items from the blade-eating battleaxe to the midnight beacon, along with expanded rules for legendary items
A comprehensive mythic skills system, alongside rules for mythic curses and traps, replacing magic items with inherent abilities, and an extensive discussion of the unique challenges of mythic play!
Extensive hyperlinked referencing for ease of reference in the PDF version.
and much Much MUCH MORE!

178401.name: Ultimate Relationships
178401.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Ultimate Relationships contains a system for relationships that provides a meaningful progression and story for the significant NPCs your PCs might encounter in the course of a campaign, including secrets to uncover as the relationship progresses, and hurdles for the PC and the NPC to overcome together. Unlike other relationship systems that bottleneck on certain skills, often Diplomacy, Ultimate Relationships allows everyone to progress and reveal the NPC’s story at their own rate; it just might take some characters longer than others.

This product contains a set of core relationship rules for making these kinds of interactions between PCs and NPCs a rich and vibrant part of your campaign. They are suitable for use in any campaign, but for groups playing in the official published Adventure Paths we will also be releasing a series of modules featuring the core NPCs from those Adventure Paths, as well as new NPCs introduced in the respective Adventure Path Plug-Ins from Legendary Games.

The first such product, Imperial Relationships, describes how to use these rules in the Far Eastern Adventure Path, including four relationship links, one each for the Caravan Master, Destined Empress, Elven Protector, and Mystic Seer, with further modules to come to further expand the available NPC relationships in that Adventure Path as well as others.

178402.name: Pour It To 'Em Boys
178402.description:
Pour It To 'Em Boys is an accurate fast play rule set for the American Civil War. It is designed for an evening's fun with a few figures or for a large battle with no paperwork. As written the rules are for 15mm, 20mm, and 25mm models. For 5mm to 10mm substitute centimeters for inches. The rules are written for reasonable people. If there is a disagreement during a game each player rolls 2 dice and the high scorer makes his/her point.

Originally published without copyright.

These rules were previously published as a broader period rules set titled "Kepi & Pickelhaube".

178403.name: No Quarter (Issue 45 - Nov 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Foundry, Forge & Crucible: Tools of the Trade
Modeling & Painting Quick Tips: Where There's Smoke
The Care and Maintenance of Steamjacks
The Gavyn Kyle Files: Bloody Barnabas
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178403.description: Published simultaneously in print and PDF versions.

178404.name: Ortuga
178404.description:
A family board game for pirates
Backgammon style roll and move.
Collecting gold and item cards
Trying to collect a set and get all your counter off the board.

178405.name: Ellie Lou's Memories
178405.description:
This memory game contains 12 sets of puzzles and their respective puzzle boards, which are used to play a number of competitive or cooperative games within the predetermined time limits.

For example, when playing a competitive game, each player chooses a set of puzzles and places its pieces in the center of the playing surface face down, together with other players’ puzzle pieces.

All players take turns pointing to a missing piece on their own puzzle boards and turning over a puzzle piece to see if there is a match. Before passing the turn to the next player, any matching puzzle piece is placed on the corresponding puzzle board, while a mismatched puzzle piece is turned to face down again in the center of the playing surface.

The goal of this game is to be the first player to complete his/her puzzle board.

178406.name: Cat and Chocolate: Nichijou Arc
178406.description:
A version of Cat and Chocolate with everyday scenarios. Each turn, the active player draws an event card depicting a certain crisis they must handle - being chased by bees! Bad breath! Or a long line for the bathroom! The player then chooses one to three item cards from their hand and explains how they use these items to get out of the situation.

Other players then vote on whether or not the active player succeeds; if a majority of players agree, the player keeps the event card. At the beginning of the game, players are secretly divided between Team Cat and Team Chocolate. The game is over when a special "End!" event card is drawn, at which point players reveal their team allegiance and count up the number of event cards they've won for their side. The team with the most event cards is the winner!

178407.description:
Players play Vikings chieftains, seeking to develop their own territory.

Each player uses his own deck of cards (preconstructed or drafted). The deck includes Location, Unit and Treasure cards. Location and Unit cards are placed in the territory when played. Treasure cards provide an immediate effect and are then discarded.

Common Location cards are placed in the center of the table and
can be used by all players. Unit cards can use them to collect resources, become first player, gain Victory Points, launch Expeditions agains the other players, ...

At the beginning, the players only have their Patriarch. By expanding their territory with Location and Unit cards, they will be able to perform more actions. Playing cards and restoring Units requires resources and these are scarce as players compete for them.

At the end of the game, players tally their points: VP gained during the game plus 1 or 2 VP per card in their territory (2 if the Patriarch became King).

The player who won the most Victory Points wins the game.

The game box provides all components to play a 2 to 4-player game. It contains 20 rare cards out of 40.
Booster packs sold separately provide 16 common cards and 5 rare cards.
178407.name: Heimskringla

178408.name: Best Movie Never Made
178408.description:
The party game with movies you joke about making with friends.

Its an adult themed party game where you get to pick the star and the category for the movie you are developing for the round. But your plot is entirely luck of the draw meaning its picked at random and it can make or break your movie. The judge of the round picks the movie they would most be willing to see... or the best sold. Which-ever way they choose, the first to 3 or 6 - three card combos, wins.

The box contains 300 cards. 100 stars, 100 categories, 100 plots. Players use a hand of 4 stars and 4 categories, choosing 1 of each for their round (unless they have a card that says different.

178409.name: Spandex! A Simple Superhero Game
178409.description:
User Summary

Spandex is a rules-light, humorous superhero game by Seth Zaloudek that fits on a single page. It's free.

178410.name: Limes: Ein letztes Kärtchen
178410.description: Just the rule on a single coaster. Now there is an additional 17th round of play where you can cover an already played tile and place another figure.

178411.name: Celluloid Follies
rpgseries: RPG Geek Fiasco Playset Contest 2015: Mythical / Supernatural
178411.description: Author Summary: This playset for Fiasco represents the world of short cartoons, and the human and animated stars that make them. Play it for straight noir and let the laughter come naturally.

178412.description:
May 2015 Subscriber Promo Card

Ally
Traits:
Goblin, Rogue, Veteran

Check to Acquire:
(Dexterity, Acrobatics 8) OR (Charisma, Diplomacy 7)

Powers:
Reveal this card and discard any number of cards from the top of your deck; for each card discarded, add 1d6 to our check to defeat a barrier.

Discard this card to explore your location. If you are the only character at your location, add 1d6 plus the scenario's adventure deck number to your combat checks during this exploration.
178412.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – "Chuffy Lickwound" Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

178413.description:
Barrier

Traits:
Temptation
Mythic

Check to Defeat:
None

Powers:
Display this card next to your deck; the barrier is defeated.

You may banish this card to roll 2d20. Add the higher result to your check, then bury a number of cards from your hand, discard pile, and deck equal to the lower result.
178413.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – "Temptation of Big Die" Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

178414.name: Battle Axe
178414.description:
Battle Axe is a simple diceless tabletop system for skirmish-level battles in the fantasy genre. It uses a card-based system that offers a wealth of options in game-play and allows players the experience of seeing their tactical decisions win the day, rather than the luck of the dice. By combining the best that CCG and tabletop gaming have to offer you end up with a system that offers endless options and expansion.

The rules and cards provided in the Deluxe Set will be enough to get you started, and new characters and rule expansions are available to increase both the size and composition of your War Bands.

178415.name: 600: il Secolo di Ferro
178415.description:
A card game, set in the Iron Age and created in Italy to be used in school, right after the lessons about the Iron Age (Secolo di Ferro).

Its 150 cards depict seven different cultures: Catholics, Protestants, Scientists, Demoniacs, Pirates, Turks and Artists.

Card types span from figures (Protagonists and Characters) to Strongholds, Objects and Specials. 31 Attack cards are provided to weaken the enemy cities.

To win, you have to create a city containing figures from at least five cultures.

Played in the classroom, the game entertains the children while helping them remember some key concepts about the Iron Age.

178416.name: The Renaissance Faire
rpgseries: RPG Geek Fiasco Playset Contest 2015: Mythical / Supernatural
178416.description:
Designer Blurb

In this Fiasco playset, players take on the role of cast, crew, and attendees of a renaissance faire. It includes the option for some mythic/supernatural participants and is based on the author's 10 years of experience at the Michigan Renaissance Festival.

178417.name: Schnell Mal Eben
178417.description:
From the designer's introduction (German)

Ich habe Schnell Mal Eben geschrieben, weil ich ein einfaches, schnelles und flexibles System brauchte und gerade keines fand. Es ist hauptsächlich für den Einsatz auf Cons, für One-Shots und für kurze Kampagnen gedacht. Für Situationen, in denen man nicht allzu viel Zeit mit dem System verlieren will, aber trotzdem etwas an der Hand haben will, was die wichtigsten Situationen regeltechnisch erfasst.

User summary
Schnell Mal Eben is a rules-light generic RPG by Gabriel Akira Schreiber specifically designed with short campaigns and one-shots in mind. The rules center on conflict resolution instead of distributing narrative rights (who gets to say what s.th. is like).

178418.name: Fate of the Norns: The Illuminated Edda
rpg: Fate of the Norns (Runic Game System)
178418.description:
The Viking tales of gods, giants and heroes come alive within the pages of the Illuminated Edda. Visit the majestic city of Asgard- home of the gods. Fight legendary dragons alongside Sigurd, renowned hero. Witness the creation of the world tree Yggdrasil along with the awesome worlds that hang upon its branches. Get entwined in Loki’s schemes as he saves the gods from disaster, and then witness as he makes matters worse.

The Illuminated Edda contains a brand-new translation of the Poetic and Prose Eddas by Andrew Valkauskas. This illustrated translation has been rewritten using contemporary prose making it a pleasure to read. Get the authenticity and truthful ness of the stories without having to worry about the complexity of older academic translations. These faithful works have been painstakingly ordered into a chronology that offers a compelling overarching storyline. All the gaps in the narrative have been rounded out with the author’s own tales involving the heroes and villains of the Viking age.

Over 600 pages are devoted to the exploration of the ancient beliefs of the Viking age. Every page is illuminated with unique evocative art. Barriers are shattered as adjacent mythologies are explored in conjunction with the Norse myths. This offers a new and unique view into what these mighty explorers may have faced as they raided and traded with their neighbours. The Illuminated Edda contains…

• All 35 poems found in traditional Poetic Eddas

• The Prose Edda (Gylfaginning and Skaldskaparmal)

• Rare works such as Heidrek the Wise

• Select stories from the Celtic myths (Lebor Gabala)

• Handpicked stories from the Welsh myths (Mabinogion)

• Select stories from the Finnish epic The Kalevala

• Handpicked stories from the Baltic myths

• Select stories from the Inuit myths

• Bonus sagas that come from the imaginative mind of Andrew Valkauskas

• An extensive glossary of characters, magical items and places

• A simple story telling game using the Futhark runes

• Beautiful and inspiring artwork from talented artists to enhance and delight your senses.

Come and discover the genuine history of the Vikings, from the mind of the author who has researched and made Viking history his passion for the last 25 years.

YouTube Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kcHzN67loA0

"Andrew Valkauskas and his talented team of artists have produced a truly remarkable and encyclopedic mythological compendium. Filling in the gaps in the surviving record with Valkauskas' own imaginative understanding of Viking Age mythology and providing supple and powerful retellings of traditional myth, along with parallel myths from other European cultures, this book gives vivid life to a lost thought-world that yet still resonates with us today."- Dr. Carolyne Larrington (Professor in Medieval English Literature, Oxford)

"THE ILLUMINATED EDDA is one of the most beautiful books I have ever had the pleasure to read. Couple this welcoming, sink-into-the-book presentation with the clarity and accessibility of the author's translation, and you've got the essential reference. This opens the door for the layperson to experience the root lore and enjoy the Eddas as saga. Bravo! This should delight librarians (like me), fantasy lovers (like me), gamers (like me), and just plain readers (like me), and should be in every school where English is used. Thank you!"- Ed Greenwood, author and game designer, creator of The Forgotten Realms

178420.name: Tirant Lo Blanc
178420.description:
From the back of the book:
Tirant Lo Blanc is a game of chivalry set in the Catalan Counties of the XI Century. The game explains how the real knights lived. It also has detailed information about Counts and Viscounts that lived in that century, and a chapter dedicated to everyday life at that time.

The game system is an evolution of the system explained in Almogàvers and the systems are usable together.

178421.name: Mesopotamians
178421.description:
From the introduction:

Through some terrible black magic, the evil sorceress Azita has resurrected the rulers of ancient Mesopotamian empires. She hoped to have these undead warlords act as generals of her undead army, leading her conquest of the modern world. Instead, you started a rock band.

178422.name: At the Hands of an Angry God
rpg: At the Hands of an Angry God
178422.description:
From the Publisher's Website

"We shall create the Perfect society!"

At the Hands of an Angry God mixes storytelling-roleplaying and civilization-building mechanics to help you and your friends to create the epic stories of brave souls willing to risk everything to establish their version of a perfect world... and what happens when 'reality' challenges those ideals.

- Players represent factions attempting to establish a self-contained, Utopian community.
- Any type of society is possible, from a theocracy to a plutocracy to whatever-ocracy you can imagine!
- Any type of setting is possible, from Puritan settlers in the New World to a space-faring community surviving planetary devastation, or modern religious zealots.
- Play can be cooperative, competitive, or a mix of both.
- The rules allow for as many settings as you can imagine!
- Perfect as a filler for single-session games, or adaptable to a series of game sessions following each Era of the civilization.

178423.name: The Grizzly Graveyard of Grimgortha
178423.description:
From the publisher's website.

So much dreadful energy seems to emanate from Grimgortha Graveyard you can truly feel it in your bones—and it does not feel good. Surely something that radiates this kind of evil must be imbued with a darkness so vile it defies all that is good in the universe. It must also be protecting something of great value, though one would hope your concern is ridding the world of its evil.

178424.name: Sjaudvergrhall
178424.description:
From the publisher's website.

Reginn, son of Hreiðmarr (king of dwarves), was a dvergr (dwarf) of not only great size, but of skill and wisdom. Dark in spirit and versed in magic, Reginn created a testament to himself in Sjaudvergrhall (“hall of the seven dwarves”)—a series of trials meant to test the bravest and most heroic of men, while proving the superiority of dwarvenkind.

178425.name: Þrymjahellir
178425.description:
From the publisher's website.

When the PCs come across the entrance to Þrymjahellir, they find two pairs of half-elves in a stand-off. Each pair claims the others are dopplegangers, and are preventing them from going inside the cave, where they wish to confront a small tribe of red dwarves and reclaim a stolen magic item (an axe named Tuireann).

178426.name: Foray to Filmarion Wood
178426.description:
From the publisher's website.

The farmers of Talysdour Hamlet are exasperated. For months, their farmlands have been ravaged and their crops eaten by what they believe to be giant burrowing rodents of some sort. The people of Talysdour are simple folk in desperate need of help without much to offer as a reward. Can you find it in the goodness of your heart to help them?

178427.name: Tomb of Ludor the Beheader
178427.description:
From the publisher's website.

Ludor the Beheader was a vicious warlord renowned equally for his avarice, his strength, and his sadism. Ludor the Beheader, son of Finnur the Wanderer, was alternately known as Ludor the Black (a reference to his steely black eyes), and Ludor the Devourer (a reference to his appetite for wealth, women, and blood).

178429.name: Size Matters
178429.description:
How great are your Guestimates?

The question master reads the question, all the other players agree on a guestimate. The question master has three shouts: 'more', 'less', or 'exact' … Size matters!

178430.name: Premier Anglais
178430.description: Children are introduced to their first English words by seeing, hearing, and speaking them. Included are a pair matching game and a bingo game. Early exposure to a foreign language promotes children's communication skills and strengthens their self confidence.

178431.name: Nimmerland
178431.description:
From the publisher's website.

For centuries, Nimmerland (and its surrounding minor islands) lay in relative obscurity. Though spitting distance from several waterborne trade routes, its location (even its existence) was a secret kept by the derelicts, deserters, smugglers, pirates, and recluses that called it home. However, it has recently been “discovered” by the outside world and dubbed “Nimmerland,” the land that was “never” there.

Included are background information, adventure seeds, and wandering monster charts for the various areas of Nimmerland (Nimmer Isle, the Lower Jungles, the Upper Plains, Pirates Cove, Vamwalye Forest, Bear Canyon, Mermaid Lagoon, Aglar Bog and the smaller surrounding islands).

178432.name: The Auroral Arcazal of Aethaungor
178432.description:
From the publisher's website.

The home of legendary merchant Aethaungor Atano has been overrun by giant ants. While most of the building’s inhabitants fled for their safety, the traders and merchants that normally deal with Aethaungor have not seen nor heard from the man in quite some time. While Aethaungor was tough, he was also fair, and generally no one wished him harm. Nonetheless, rumors run rampant.

178433.name: The Inexplicable Ice Tower of Inverlock Isle
178433.description:
From the publisher's website.

The clear blue skies over the rolling green fields of Orlea have given way to the dismal haze of threatening clouds pouring cold rain and sleet. The source of this recent and everpresent gloom... a mysterious tower of ice on a small island in the center of Inverlock Lake. The slender, frosty spire rose from the ground to a height of well over 500' in just a few weeks. No one seems to really know what the tower is or why it appeared, but whatever is happening can’t be good.

178434.name: Teach Me How to Demon
rpgseries: RPG Geek Fiasco Playset Contest 2015: Mythical / Supernatural
178434.description:
Playset for the game Fiasco by Jason Morningstar, published by Bully Pulpit Games. Playset was written for the Mythical/Supernatural playset competition on RPGGeek.com.

WELCOME TO THE LEGION.
When Lucifer was cast down from the heavens after his pride and defiance distanced himself from God’s glory, he took one-third of the angels of Heaven with him. Now reigning as the Prince of the Power of the Air, the Demon Formerly Known As Lucifer has armies of demonic spirits that do his evil bidding. But what of those that aren’t as smart, physically adept, or let’s face it, evil, as the rest of the fallen? They get relegated to a special fighting force reserved for the easiest, most menial tasks a demon could undertake, with the occasional impossible challenge thrown in just to keep things honest. In order to protect their fragile egos from discovering how incompetent they truly are, they have been given the name Legio Et Exitia Ruina -- The Legion of Total Destruction.

Have a cat that got lost in Fresno? Ever seen a kid throwing rocks off an overpass in Alabama? Wonder why that sump pump failed in that house in Munich? Maybe the TV in your hotel room in Adelaide inexplicably wouldn’t change channels when Gigli was on. You can thank the demonic forces of Legio Et Exitia Ruina at work in places all over the globe . . . because they don’t get thanked by anyone else.

178435.name: Piltrufos: El juego de Rol piltrufántemente Piltrufero
178435.description:
User summary:

A humorous Spanish-language RPG of playing "pitufos" (Smurfs)

178436.name: HARTU!
178436.description:
A family friendly abstract strategy game designed for two or four players played on a multi colored checkered board.

The object of the game is to score as many points as possible by moving both your own pieces and those of your opponents off your colored edge of the board.

This is accomplished by rolling the die and deciding whether to choose to place a new piece on the board, move one of your own playable pieces, or move an opponent's piece that is currently located on your colored half of the board.

At the end of the game, players tally the points in their booty bags and the player with the highest point total is the winner.

178437.name: Fate of the Norns: Ragnarok - Lords of the Ash
rpg: Fate of the Norns (Runic Game System)
178437.description:
Lords of the Ash is a source book for the Fate of the Norns: Ragnarok RPG. It contains lore materials on the outer realms of: Asgard, Vanagard, Nidavellir, Muspelheim, Jotunheim and Niflheim.

+ More myths on the Viking pantheons (Aesir, Vanir, Dvergar, Rime Jorun, Muspeli Jotun and Hel)

+ Locales of majesty and maps on the new realms

+ All new playable archetypes

+ 3 new/expanded immortal Disir archetypes

+ New powers and skills

+ 3 new magic systems

+ Magical relics of power

+ Saga starter vignettes

+ 2 full sagas

+ A universal rune game system (URGS)

178438.name: Trivial Gay
178438.description: The game contains 140 questions, which can be answered by the players. It also contains 10 activity cards with a variety of tasks to be carried out. It basically works like a travel edition of the game Trivial Pursuit.

178439.name: Memorial Day: A 2-Page Quick-Flick
178439.description:
From Publisher's Website:


...a quick-flick for the Slasher Flick roleplaying game that follows the horror movie tradition of being based on a specific holiday.

A sadistic 1930s-era bank robber died in a hail of gunfire while attempting to rob a small-town bank. As he took his dying breath, he swore to kill everyone in the town... no matter what. It happened on Memorial Day and every year on that day, he returns from the grave to carry out his revenge. Now, over 80 years later, a group of holiday vacationers whose vehicle has broken down nearby walks into the now-abandoned town, completely unaware that they are in mortal danger... because it's Memorial Day.

178441.name: Ramayana
178441.description:
User Summary

The game based on Indian epic poem Ramayana which depicts the duties of relationships, portraying ideal characters like the ideal father, servant, brother, wife, and king.

178442.description:
Welcome to a land where creation is but a simple step away from ingenuity plus a few simple resources imbued with ancient alchemy - this is Alkemia. Prepare to harness the primal art of alchemy and to join the ranks of creators who have been shaping and reforming the raw land of Alkemia into a thriving livelihood centered on a grand city of alchemy deemed Crasis. Governed by a circle of seers and a single Grand Alchemist, who wields boundless talent and protects the ancient secrets of the Greater Elemental Spirits, Crasis now seeks its next Grand Alchemist, who will be one of the few alchemists attempting to prove their abilities by synthesizing the legendary Crest of Creation. This crest, a fabled mysticism documented to usher the golden age of alchemy and balance, can only be crafted by one skilled alchemist able to harness the five elements of earth, fire, water, air, and ether, using both natural and manufactured resources.

Take to the urban bazaars and elemental wilds of a land that is enriched by the power of alchemy blessed by the elements. Players can look forward to managing organic resources as one of six characters to craft powerful items in a race to become the Grand Alchemist. First, harvest the Foraging Fields to gather your base reagents and collect recipes used to craft items; then, alchemists will combine their base reagents to synthesize items from their recipes – all with usable effects aimed to both assist the creator and hinder competitors.
Players will ultimately quell everything at their disposal to create their own legendary Crest of Creation via a randomly generated recipe gained through playing, which will lead the most skilled alchemist to victory. Do you have what it takes to be worthy of the Crest of Creation? Be prepared, for Destiny’s recipe calls for you
178442.name: Alkemia

178443.name: DarkBase 01
178443.description:
User Summary

Not related to the browser game series of DarkBase, this game revolves around your character, Jason Phoenix, investigating a base that you quickly realize is overrun with aliens. You can shoot the aliens (and they can shoot you) as you wander around gaining P point tiles, medical kits to heal yourself, and keys to open sections on each floor of the base. The graphics are very simple, the music simpler, and the strategy, the grindingly simplest of all.

178444.name: No Quarter (Issue 46 - Jan 2013)
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
178444.description: Published simultaneously as print and PDF versions.

178445.description:
The Turncoat Start Card Expansion includes one card/tile that may be used with all Spurs and Sprockets card/tile decks.

The Turncoat card/tile has a single orthogonal line on one side and a single diagonal line on the other side. After deciding which side you will be playing with the Turncoat is placed on the field first and the start player places his/her card/tile adjacent to the Turncoat. Play continues based on the Spurs and Sprockets rules you have decided to play with. The Turncoat has a 2 on it and it may be added in the normal manner to all players adjacent rows for attacking, defending or scoring purposes.
At the biginning of your turn you may turn the Turncoat 90 degrees.
The Turncoat may be destroyed by using Tic Attack Toe or Fired Away rules.
178445.name: Spurs and Sprockets: Turncoat

178446.name: No Thank You, Evil!
178446.description:
Box set for No Thank You, Evil! contains tokens, cards, sheets, dice, and the rule book--everything you need to play the game.

The Kickstarter Box of Awesome edition contains everything the basic box contains but with several components of premium quality.

178447.description: "White Dwarf Presents" a book of collected Battlefleet Gothic articles from the English and German editions of White Dwarf all in English. Rules and scenarios, collecting and tactics, new ships and battle reports.
178447.name: Warp Storm

178448.name: Berge des Wahnsinns: Die epische Kampagne
178448.description:
Berge des Wahnsinns, so wird ein mystischer Gebirgszug in der Antarktis genannt, an dem die letztegroße Expedition der Miskatonic-Universität aus Arkham gescheitert ist. Nur wenige kehrten aus dem Eis zurück, und die es taten, waren rasend vor Irrsinn oder geistig gebrochen.

A mystical mountain range in Antarctica is called Mountains of Madness. That is where the last major expedition of Miskatonic University from Arkham has failed. Few returne from the ice, and who did it, was mad or mentally broken.

This is the complete edition of the campaign and brings together the contents of the previously three-volume campaign in full color layout.

178449.name: LEGO Duplo Train
178449.description:
Driving the colourful LEGO® DUPLO® Train from station to station is a toddler’s dream. Your child will play the role of the train driver - choosing and loading wagons, building bridges, stopping at crossings, refueling and laying new tracks around pesky rocks.

Copying grownups and their activities is important to your 2-year-old toddler’s development - and few things are quite as ‘grownup’ as driving a huge steam train around the the bright and friendly LEGO® countryside, horns tooting.

If your toddler is fascinated by trains, this simple game will provide new inspiration for hours of creative play - with or without a LEGO® DUPLO® train set.

Source: The Publisher Website.

178450.description:
Side Quest is a dungeon crawling card game that fits in your pocket. With a single deck of cards and a couple of dice you and up to 3 friends can battle your way through a decision-packed dungeon. Fight monsters, grab loot and rescue maidens as you gear up your characters to fight the boss at the end of the dungeon.

Side Quest is a fully co-operative game - if any Heroes (or maidens!) die, the game is lost.

There are a wide range of scenarios to play, including ultra-tough single-player missions, challenging 30 minute pick-up games and lengthy 2 hour dungeon treks. With loads of different Heroes, Monsters and Equipment cards you'll never play the same game twice.

Plan together, fight together, win together!
178450.name: Side Quest
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 090 - Cards of Cthulhu

178451.name: Heroes of Troy: A Game of the Trojan War for One to Two Players.
178451.description:
INTRODUCTION: Heroes of Troy is a Game set during the Trojan War, according to Homer’s ‘The Iliad’. The game focuses on the man-to-man combat that is so prevalent throughout The Iliad. Players will assume the role of a Commander of either the Achaean (Greek) or Trojan Armies during the Trojan War.

OBJECTIVE: The First player to capture at least two of the three Rear Sectors of their Opponent wins the Game. Alternatively, the Player who scores the most Victory Points (VP) for slaying opposing Warriors during the Turn in which the last Fate Card is Drawn, wins.

178452.description:
With the second edition 6 promotional cards were given out by the publisher. They are numbered 67 - 72.
The German card names are:
67 - Wanderkrämer
68 - Hofhändler
69 - Schindler
70 - Pflücker
71 - Zuchtmeister
72 - Handwerker
178452.name: La Granja: 2nd Edition Promo Cards

178453.description:
"3 designers, 6 games, 15 dice."

6 is a collaboration between three game designers to provide a collection of light dice games. The tin contains a collection of dice and rules for six games that can be played with them. The games are:

Airstrike: Drop dice sequentially onto the table to obtain a combination of values positions that ensures your bombers make it home.

Dicey Winks: A dexterity game about launching dice from the '6' tin to land your dice near to a target while displacing your opponent's dice.

Foiled: A dueling simulation and bluffing game about selecting the right dice and maneuvers to strike your opponent to push them off the piste.

Slipstream: A risk management racing game, in which turn order is determined by current score.

Triangles: A bidding game in which you must spot and exploit the highest value triangle that you can land your scoring die inside.

Wrestle: Establish the best hold to limit your opponents opportunities to escape it before running out of strength.

178454.description:
In Conservation Crisis you set out to save your chosen species from extinction. You do this by acquiring resources for your reserve and creating environments where the animals can survive alongside the local communities. Its design combines the experiences Richard has had through his conservation work and our combined love of board games.

Conservation Crisis has been designed with education and family fun in mind. Several complex and conflicting real world decisions are simplified into the game mechanics. However players should understand that conservation is never simple neither in the game or in real life.

One-third of profits from the sale of the board game ‘Conservation Crisis’ together with all donations received from play-testing ‘Conservation Crisis’ via the Tunza Games website will be shared between the David Shepherd Wildlife Foundation (Registered Charity No. 1106893) and up to two other charitable foundations working to protect wildlife.
178454.name: Conservation Crisis

178455.name: Hot Pursuit
178455.description:
The card passing, hand trading game of playing matchmaker in 1940’s New York. Great for 1 – 10 players, taking about 10 minutes per game. Hot Pursuit uses 3 cards per player and only needs your hands. New cards aren’t drawn or played – no table needed!

A modern man, done with his day’s work, steps out of his office tower’s lobby into the busy bustle of a city sidewalk. Just as he is getting his bearings set towards home, he collides with someone. He apologizes profusely. She politely excuses herself. He tries to ask if she’s alright but she just scurries off again. Who was that lovely lady and why was she in such a hurry? Now, it’s time for you to be a true friend and help this modern man find his missing beauty.

GAMEPLAY: 3 cards are dealt to each player. Whomever is dealt the Pink card becomes the Jealous Ex bent on sabotaging the game, the person who receives the Blue card is the Modern Man, and everyone else is a friend. All of the friendly players earn a joint victory by passing and trading until the Pink and Blue cards are both in the Modern Man's hand, facing him. However, the Jealous Ex wins if he/she can manipulate the Pink and Blue cards together, facing anyone who is not the Modern Man. ***Extra rules and story for solitaire, 2 players, and team play with player elimination, included!

178456.name: Shadow Dancer
178456.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about the prestige class called
the Shadow Dancer, the half-seen artists of deception.

The feats inside this volume:

Improved Dodge - Your Dodging ability is now improved
Improved Shadow Illusion - When it comes to shadow illusions, yours are now better
One with shadows - Become even more stealthy in shadows
Shadow Adept - Saving throws are improved in low light
Shadow Healing - If in shadows or low light, healing effects work better
Shadow Strike - Attacks from shadows or low lights can be more deadly
Strength of Shadows - Effective level is higher when in low light

178457.name: Blades of Myth and Lore
178457.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blades of Myth and Lore is a collection of 28 swords designed for use with the Modern Monks role playing game, the original game it is based on, and most other old school style retro-clones. It contains a mix of original weapons and interpretations of swords from mythology and history.

178458.name: Wild Things: Options for Animal Companions
178458.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dance on the Wild Side!

Animal companions. They’re practically characters in their own right, and a surprisingly large number of classes have access to them, but somehow, through a mix of being difficult to roleplay and having much less options for customization, they always seem to wind up forgotten in the background. Don’t let this fate happen to your animal companion!

This book presents a variety of new options for customizing animal companions and making them more relevant in your game. First, the book presents several new classes specifically for animal companions, allowing you to choose what type of animal companion you want: from the ferocious fearsome beast, to the implacable stalwart sentinel. Those looking for a less combat-inclined animal companion might look to the sage counselor—which responds particularly well to its handler’s magic—or the sly varmint, which allows the animal companion to serve the utility role of a rogue, to a lesser extent. The noble steed is perfect for paladins and cavaliers, and the spirit guide reinforces a cleric or inquisitor’s zeal and moral views.

Beyond this, there are a wide variety of new feats and spells that feature animal companions, including several feats made specifically for animals, and a collection of teamwork feats for animal companions and their handlers, helping the two to fight in sync. Finally, a brief section discusses some of the common pitfalls and difficulties of roleplaying an animal companion, and some ways to combat them.

Your animal companion deserves to be just as special and customized as the character that it comes with. Don’t just settle for the defaults. Pick up this book, and never look at animal companions the same way again.

178459.name: Alternate Archetypes, Archer
178459.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a two new archetypes based on the fighter's archer archetype. The Bow Master is an archetype for the Barbarian core class and the Marksman is an archetype for the Rogue core class. Both archetypes are heavily influenced by the class abilities granted by the fighter's archetype including bonuses to hit with missile weapon, ability to avoid attacks of opportunity, and even gaining Damage Reduction from ranged attacks.

178460.name: Feats Unbound
178460.description:
From publisher blurb:

Never see Feats the same way again!

Why should feats have the same benefits to every class, check out favored class options for feats. Skill synergy may be a thing of the past, but Feat Synergy grants additional benefits to those that like to mix them up.

In addition nearly 50 new feats are given and over 20 feats that may have originated elsewhere but have been given a whole new fresh perspective.

178461.name: Perils of the Broken Road
178461.description:
From publisher blurb:

An enterprising gnome merchant seeks to reopen the long-abandoned underground road between his town and a dwarven settlement several days distant. The road has been untraveled for centuries, so he needs a group of brave explorers to venture forth along the abandoned route. More than monsters and underground hazards await: the intrepid adventurers uncover a wide-reaching plot that puts their skills and knowledge of the Broken Road to the test!

"Perils of the Broken Road" also contains an eight-page gazetteer of Fibblebrod, the launching point for this adventure and a frontier boom town suitable for use in any game world.

"Perils of the Broken Road" is an underground and urban adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game suitable for any game world. Presented for PCs of 3rd or 4th level, this adventure also includes notes and statistics for scaling challenges for PCs of higher or lower level. "Perils of the Broken Road" also includes full alternate statistics compatible with the beginner rules variant of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. The adventure contains player handouts, pregenerated characters, and a file containing full-color 1 inch square maps of the encounter areas ready for printing.

178462.name: Light Escort Cruiser
178462.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a 5000 dT jump capable light cruiser.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

178464.name: The Witch of the Tarriswoods
178464.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need an adventure that's ready to play? That includes printable maps, pregenerated characters, and map images for Virtual Tabletops? Welcome to Sharp Mountain games.

Strange Creatures are disturbing the peaceful town of Adela. Residents suspect an evil witch is causing trouble in the nearby Tarriswoods. Who will seek out the source of these troubles?
This product includes:

a base town and local personalities (NPC’s)
color maps (and printer friendly versions)
new monsters
pregenerated player characters (PC’s)
map images for use with a Virtual Tabletop
printable large maps




This adventure can be used with your favorite old school fantasy ruleset, retroclone, or retro-inspired game with little or no modifications. It can also be used with later editions with a little tweaking.

178465.name: The Thingomancer
178465.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unleash the strangeness that is the thingomancer! A prestige class with powers over randomness itself. With the help of his mighty thingamajig, the thingomancer is ready for any and all eventuality, no monster can withstand the onslaught of the thingomancer’s weapons (he seems to have one for every occasion). The thingomancer even gains power over rod of wonders and decks of many things!

What started as an April fool’s joke ended as an endearing prestige class.

178466.name: TetrAction: The Duel of Wisdom
178466.description:
For a long time ago,three witches duel each other for that get the epic magical relic called "Tetrite".
They must draw magical power form 3 tetrite, and cast their spells for beat their opponent.
It depends on your choice which witch will can survive?

TetrAction is a game of Three-dimensional puzzle for 2 players.
Your goal is to beat your opponent that you must decrease opponent's life 15 to 0.

The feature of this game is 3 tetrahedrons.They have 3 colors: red,blue,and yellow.Their surface have one of them.
On the board and your hand(reveal) have some magic scroll.
It have cost that 3 colors and sequences.

[example1] R:Red B:Blue Y:Yellow X:any color
If the cost is "RRRXX" 3 surface in your view must be RRRXX.

178467.name: Boom Town
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
178467.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

Cast of Cards: Boom Town (Modern)

The Wild West is full of colorful characters, and if your player group is traveling through a frontier town, you’ll need NPCs for them to interact with. Boom Town gives you just that! Included here are 17 fully-statted characters ready to populate any frontier town.

178468.name: Modern Maps: NewU Gym
178468.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blessed Machine's Modern Maps #1 contains floorplans for NewU Gym in magnificient full color. The two floor facility is detailed with two single page maps and a detailed key to all the rooms on the maps. This is followed up with multiple map pages that can be cut and pasted together to provide tabletop size maps to explore and engage in combat.

178469.name: Betrayal at Lucir (Pathfinder)
rpgseries: Sundered Chronicles: The Redemption of Aranure
178469.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the kingdom of Aranure fell long ago, the fey of the Luciran Woods were a key piece of the demon lord Malak’ s forces. Many of the fey in the woods succumbed to the influence of the demon lord and rallied behind his banner.

After the war was over, people returned to the town of Lucir, where they lived in peace for many years. The fey have become restless once again and tragedy has struck at the local Church of Aelastrea!

In this module, you’ll find:

The town of Lucir and the surrounding Luciran Woods, a detailed town and explorable area with room to grow.
Two events designed to take a moderate length game session each to complete, and written to be modular so they can be played with this adventure or dropped into your own.
Two brand new monsters.
Details on the religion of Aelastrea, Lady of Forests.

178470.description:
Exclusive alien miniature not contained in retail copies of Chaosmos.

Comes with miniature, alien sheet and power tokens for the campaign mode.

He doesn't have a native planet and his alien power lets him copy other alien's powers!

After the aliens have been dealt to the players, Mor'ls collects the unused alien and puts them in front of him face up.

At the start of his turn he activates one alien and puts it face down. For the reminder of the turn he can use the powers of that alien. Next turn, he chooses a different alien and puts it face down using that power instead...

He must use all the powers before he can refresh all of them.
178470.name: Chaosmos: Mor'ls The Mimic

178471.name: The Gar'Haden Family Crypt
178471.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Gar’Haden Family Crypt is a one-page Swords and Wizardry mini-dungeon for 4-6 characters of levels 1-3. It is designed to fit into any campaign or adventure, but can also be used to expand Area 4 in SC1: The Shrine of Sruukor.

In this one-page dungeon module, you’ll find:

A short dungeon adventure with 10 locations.
Expanded details for Area 4 in The Shrine of Sruukor with a brief background on the crypt.

178472.name: Pendragon
178472.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes what your campaign needs is a hero of legend, who everyone recognizes, even though they've never met her before.

Pendragon (PL 10) is one of the Great Heroes of WWII, a patriotic defender of justice and foe of tyranny, who survived decades in suspended animation to be revived in a world that more-than-ever needs a heroic role model!

178473.name: CHARIOT WARS
178473.description:
User Summary

CHARIOT WARS is a story-led racing game set in Ancient Rome.

178474.name: The Abyss (Issue 12 - Apr 1981)
rpgissuearticle: Mini Adventure - The Trial of Ptah
178474.description: Volume 3, Number 3 - new archery system, Ysgarth Rules, regeneration comments, columns.

178475.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 135 - May 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Braaaaains! And How This Game Ate Mine... Zombie Dice Designer’s Notes
The Shandler Chronicles Chapter #35: Shambler From the Past
178475.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

178476.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 136 - Jun 2011)
rpgissuearticle: A World of Beautiful Colors: The Design of Pastiche
Infinity: The Combined Army of the Evolved Intelligence
L5R RPG 4th Edition: The Great Clans — Asako Henshin
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)
178476.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

178477.name: The Abyss (Issue 13 - Jun 1981)
rpgissuearticle: What Can You Do With Chivalry and Sorcery?
Yet Another Critical and Sword of Sharpness System
178477.description: Volume 3 Number 4 - Structural strengths, alignment, critical system, Chivalry & Sorcery

178478.name: The Abyss (Issue 14 - Aug 1981)
rpgissuearticle: A Glossary of Terms and Abbreviations
Mini-Adventure: Plaza of the Dark Gods
The Ninja: A New D+D Character Class
178478.description: Volume 3 Number 5 - Magic system, experience system, Ninja, columns.

178479.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 137 - Jul 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer from Gary Games Inc
Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game — Ancient Relics Cycle
Enter the Magical World of GUBS
Infinity: The Charge of the Armored Troops
178479.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

178480.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 138 - Aug 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Getting Started — Pathfinder Beginner Box Preview
Infinity: The Rise of the O-Yoroi
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age from Gryphon Games
178480.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

178481.name: The Abyss (Issue 15 - Oct 1981)
rpgissuearticle: Backgrounding - The Secular Government of Ptolemeias
Fantasy Role Playing and the Fanatics
Skills and Training - Native and Learned Skills
178481.description: Volume 3 Number 6 - Magic items, role playing, saving throws, columns.

178482.name: TRIGON
178482.description:
Strategie Game/Placement Game for two people:

The winner is the first person who can place a pyramid, a strip or a group of stars with his own blocks. In most cases the game is then finished.

Contains 36 triangles in red and blue, 3 sets of each pieces each numbered from 1-6

General Rules:

An enclosed empty space may never be formed on the playing field.
Each block must be placed so as to be touching at least one other block on at least one side.
Star:




6 blocks of the same colour placed together in a hexagon form a star; complete stars (including those which extend into other stars) are only protected against the moves of an opponent, not against the player's own moves.

Course of the Game:
The players decide who shall start. Every player places one block of his colour. All of the blocks must be placed in the playing field before the first player begins moving or exchanging blocks. Only one block can be moved or two blocks exchanged per turn.

Moving:
A player can only move his/her own blocks at random to a new position in the playing field.

Exchanging:
The positions of two blocks may be interchanged in an exchange. A player's own blocks rnay be exchanged regardless of the numbering. A player's blocks rnay only be exchanged with those of an opponent when the numbers of both blocks are the sarne, i.e., 4 for 4.

Formations:

Pyramid:
The placing together of 16 blocks of the same colour in an equal-sided triangle.

Strip:
11 blocks of the same colour in a straight line.

Star group:
Four stars of the same colour extending into one another and containing 16-18 blocks (depending on the form of the group) make up a star group.

178483.name: Johnny Condom
178483.description:
Card Game
Object of the game: To get as many high scoring pairs as possible.
The winner: is the one with the highest score. This is determined by adding up the numbers on the right hand corner of each pair of mates.
Dealer gives each player seven cards and puts the rest of the pack in the middle, turning over the first card. Each player looks to see if he has any mates. This can be seen by matching the number at the top right hand corner. A pair must be one male and one female, not two males or females. If he has any pairs, he places them face up in front of him, so that everyone can see.
Each turn, the player must have a minimum of five cards in his hand before he starts. If his hand has become depleted because he won some pairs on his previous turn, then he must take as many cards as he needs from the middle pile to bring his hand up to five. He can take the last card thrown down by the last player as one of these cards if he wishes. If he has a pair (or pairs), he puts them in front as before so that everyone can see. At the end of his turn, he throws down one card on the upturned pile.
Tracey Trouble card can be acted upon when the player wishes to steal unprotected pairs ie: if one is picked from the pile, he may act upon it immediately or keep it until it is of more use.
Johnny Condom cards can be used whenever a player wants to protect his pairs whether he picks one up or is dealt one. To protect a pair he must place a Johnny Condom card on top of that pair.
Right Brian Bummer cards are good for nothing and are there as a joker card - mainly to hold up the game.
5When all the pairs are out and the only cards still circulating are Tracey’s, Johnny’s or Right Brian’s, then each player adds up his score and the player with the highest number is the winner.

Amusing Note: According to the back of the box there are cards called 'Right Brain Bummer', i.e. no good, but in the components they have changed to 'Right Brian Bummer'. Someone didn't do their spell-checking very well.

178485.description:
An expansion for Zombicide: Black Plague, Wulfsburg adds new tiles, heroes, equipment, and enemies to the game.

Wulfsburg is so named because of the pack of wolves that surround the area, and some of these wolves have been infected by the zombie virus. Included is a new type of Abomination, the Wolfbomination!
178485.name: Zombicide: Wulfsburg

178486.name: At Bat Game
178486.description:
A 3-in-1 in which you try to predict the Outcome of the Batter at Bat. The 3 ways are:"LIVE" Batter a Batter; from a Custom Deck of 52-Cards; a Batter from a custom 12-Sided Dice;
Using an 8-card "Master 8" deck, you choose a card that you predict will be the outcome.
The 3 versions of the game each have a different "Outcome":
"LIVE" Interactive version - Predict Outcome of Batter at bat in a live game.
"TABLE" Custom 52-Card Deck version - Predict Outcome of next card to be turned over.
"DICE" Custom 12-Sided Dice version - Predict Outcome of next roll of single 12-sided dice.
Score is kept track with "Game Tokens". Each Player starts with 15-20 (Depending upon Game Set). For each "At Bat", Players put token in and pick a Master 8 card. The Player with the most Game Tokens at the end of the game is the winner!

178487.description: In Bountytown, from Kyle Van Winkle and Michael Huven-Moore, three to six players take on the roles of unique characters in the Wild West, dueling bounties and each other in a race to build up the most Renown in Bountytown. Players move around the town, activating unique locations to gain advantages and to shore up weaknesses. The bounty hunter who has earned the most Renown when the dust settles wins the game!
178487.name: Bountytown
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 77 -- The Nuance of Taste and Things Forgotten

178488.name: Chouffe Game
178488.description: Discover the CHOUFFE world. Build La Chouffe icons out of bricks in a certain time.

178489.description: Norrköping is a game intended to promote the eponymous city and its businesses. Mechanically it is a close Monopoly clone, where you move across the board, purchases pieces of property, build on them and hope to have your opponents land on them and go bankrupt. There is also a variant which distributes a few starting properties and shortens the game overall.
178489.name: Norrköping: spelet om din stad

178490.name: GameFactory
178490.description:
In GameFactory, players lead successful computer game companies that try to create the next big hit. They must build rooms in their offices, hire staff and decide which project will be the next one to bring to market.

GameFactory is a worker placement game with a twist: players start with a small office and only a few options for their workers. They use funds to build new rooms with new capabilities and add them to their office, enabling new placement positions and new options. Players then use staff to build games or spend their work on creating other useful things that help them becoming the next computer game legend.
